They also receive a formal six-month education in financial literacy and business operations that leads to a diploma in Small and Medium Enterprise Management by the Guatemalan Technical Institute for Training and Productivity (INTECAP). Credit is not generally available to women with businesses of this size, so an important program element is a right-sized business loan. 

The women also receive coaching in leadership, economic and gender empowerment, and renegotiating household power relationships. By working with Fundación Namaste Guatemaya, the STARZ participant and her business advisor have a continuous-loop, real-time monitoring, evaluation and learning system.

loans.use: to pay for a new bookstore and paper products lines in her store.

location.town: San Juan del Obispo, Antigua, Sacatepéquez

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 52-year-old married father of nine children who has been working as a school bus driver for the last nine years since he retired from the army. Ahmad is working hard to develop his business to make sure that he can cover his family's increasing needs. Ahmad also takes care of other people's gardens for additional income. Today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to pay for his children's increasing school tuition fees. To make sure that he will provide them with the necessary education, he works hard to make sure that they get the best. He will also work on doing the necessary maintenance to his house before the coming winter season. Ahmad hopes to develop his business by increasing the number of buses he owns and recruiting more people to help him to provide this service.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and maintain his house for winter

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 32-year-old married father of one child. He has been working in the transportation business for 10 years. Ali has a small bus which he uses to transport people from one place to another. This is his main source of income. He wants to establish an additional business to make sure that he is capable of covering his beloved family's needs.
Today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to start a new agricultural business he will develop with his father's support. His father has wide experience in this domain so Ali will develop the business in a well-managed way.
Ali hopes that in the future and through his increasing income, he'll be capable of developing both businesses and he might buy another bus.

loans.use: To start a new agricultural business where he will develop it with his father's support

loans.name: Iglesia De Oxlajuj Group

texts.es:
La señora María es  casada. De edad 30 años. Curso 4 años de educacion primaria. Tiene 5 hijos y de ellos 3 van a la escuela. Se dedica a la crianza de pollos. Inició este negocio con el apoyo de su esposo y a la fecha lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de Pollos y para concentrado para alimentarlos. Desea en el futuro contar con un capital mayor y tener una granja con diferentes animales domésticos.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y actividades pecuarias.

En la fotografía del grupo aparecen 11 socias, pero, solamente a 10 de ellas se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Señora María is 30 years old and married.  She finished four years of elementary school.  She has five children, three of whom go to school.  She works raising chickens.  She began this business with the help of her husband and now has five years of experience.

She is organizing a group and asking for a loan to use to buy chickens and feed for them.  In the future, she’d like to be able to count on greater working capital and she’d like to have a farm with different farm animals.

The other members of the group work in trade and livestock.

Eleven members appear in the photo of the group, but only ten of them are taking out the loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more peppers, bitterball squash, palm-nuts, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed, 32 years old, is a married man and has children. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He works hard to provide his family with a good and healthy lifestyle. 

He has been running a spice shop for many years, in which he offers his customers all types of spice products. He has been able to attract customers after taking the first loan. He would like to acquire more products with which he can grow his business in order to achieve his objective. So, he requested a loan of 600,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB in order to buy all types of spice products. He thanks Kiva lenders for financing him with the first loan.

loans.use: to purchase all types of spices such as pepper and chili for his business.

loans.name: Al-Hilal Mahariq Group

texts.en:
Al-Hilal Mahariq is a group consisting of four ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB. 

Wafa is a 32-year-old married woman and has children. She works hard and does her best to provide her family with food and clothing. She is a housewife and dreams of raising her children well. She lives with her family in bad conditions, and she would like to buy construction supplies to use in her small house, but she suffers from a lack of money. So she is applying for a loan of 40,000 YER. In the future, she hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use in her small house.

loans.name: Group 18 - An Thanh 01

texts.en:
Thinh is 60 years old and works in agricultural production, with a monthly income of approximately 700,000 VND. Thinh and her husband are now living in a house with their grown-up son who is married. Her son has two children and they are currently attending high school.   She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1972. 

Thinh is fully aware of the fact that using a degraded double-pit latrine has the risks of potential adverse effects on the health of her family members, her community and environmental contamination. However, she has not yet been able to construct a septic tank latrine due to a shortage of funds. With a portion of this loan, she will be able to buy materials to build a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. Those facilities would help her family improve their health and living conditions, while affording safety for them (particularly at night and during rainstorms). In addition this will provide convenience, cleanliness and privacy for all family members, while contributing to the environmental protection of the community. In the picture, Thinh is the second from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clean cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) to help keep her home clean

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package, which will enable her to have a clean home and cook food quicker

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mina is a 43-year-old woman who lives with her husband Bhaben and five children in Dhupguri. All the children are students. She has attended school up to class VIII (grade 8) but her husband is illiterate, and only knows how to sign his name. 

Mina is a homemaker while her husband is a farmer, selling different vegetables in the market. The income is so inconsistent that she is unable to cover their household expenses, but Mina dreams of providing her children proper education and making them responsible and good citizens. Mina decided to cultivate broad beans with the other vegetables in her own land as there is a great demand for broad beans in her area. In that way, she will generate more income for her family. 

Mina is confident that she will grow her business with the profit she will earn from her business. She requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc. for growing broad beans which will ultimately help in generating more income. They live in a kaccha house (made of mud and straw), so in future she wants to build a concrete house with the profit from her business.

 Mina thanks BJS and Kiva lenders for funding the loan.

loans.use: To purchase bean seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for farming broad beans in her own land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for cooking gas, in order to save on cooking energy costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a set of quick-cooking gas energy so she can save on time

loans.name: Anyen Pata Group

texts.fr:
Suzanne est le coordinatrice de son groupe Anyen Pata. Elle n’est pas marie et elle a 2  enfants. Elle  habite dans la region nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limité. Elle dirige son commerce de vente de produit divers pendants les 8 dernières années.

Avant de ce commercer ce commerce elle tait  a l’ecole. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce Produits alimentaire d’un  emprunt  pour le commerce tel que ventes produits cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses, etc.  Elle  dit que son défit  principal est de devenir un plus grand commerçant du nord. 

Elle  dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un plus grand commerçant qui lui facilitera  à  voyagé dans des autre pays.
texts.en:
Suzanne is the coordinator of her group Anyen Pata. She is not married and she has 2 children. She lives in the northeastern region of Haiti where electricity is rare and drinking water is scarce. She has been managing her business selling a variety of products for the past 8 years.

Before starting this business she was in school. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business. Other members need a loan for businesses such as selling cosmetics, soft drinks, etc. She says that her main challenge is to become a bigger shopkeeper in the north.

She says that her main goal is to have a bigger business which will make it easier for her to travel to other countries.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, shoes, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Irein

texts.en:
Irein is 27 years old and married with two children. Irein works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc.

Irein has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Irein aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila tiene 63 años de edad vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña y maíz, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su familia se dedican a la crianza de aves de corral en la parte posterior a su domicilio, su esposo brinda servicios agrícolas, Teofila ha solicitado un préstamo de 700 nuevos soles para arreglar la pared de su casa que fue deteriorada por las constantes lluvias de la última temporada y de esta manera tener mayor seguridad donde residir.
texts.en: Teofila, 63, lives with her husband and children in the Cayalti district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's north coast. The residents grow sugar cane and corn, run businesses, and raise livestock. Teofila and her family raise barnyard animals behind their house, and her husband farms. Teofila has applied for a loan of 700 nuevos soles to fix a wall in her house that was damaged by last season's constant rains so that their house is safer.

loans.use: to fix a wall in her house.

loans.name: Katrina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Katrina works hard to support her family.

She has a business, selling fish in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  Katrina is borrowing 26,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Katrina has been sustaining her business activities through the previous eight loans she has borrowed from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business in order to secure her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 47 years old.  She is married and has three children.

Teresa works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items like soap, milk, sugar, coffee and noodles to sell.

Teresa has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF prior to requesting this loan.  She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from farming flowers.

Teresa aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like soap, milk, sugar, coffee and noodles.

loans.name: Jerica

texts.en:
Jerica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell frozen products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional frozen products to sell in her buy and sell frozen products business.

Jerica has been in this business for ten years; she earns more income from a general store.

Jerica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional frozen products to sell

loans.name: Juvita

texts.en:
Juvita is running a kiosk that helps her generate income for her family. 

She is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business; she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as gasoline and diesel.

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $ 200. 

Juvita is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and diesel

loans.name: Margielina

texts.en:
Margielina is married and has four children. She works hard to support her family.  She has a handicrafts business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from buying and selling cashew nuts. 

Margielina is requesting her sixteenth loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more materials for her handicrafts business. She hopes that her hard work will help her to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing maintenance business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 11 years. She earn additional income from selling food. 

Rosalina is requesting a loan from NWTF for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fishing materials for her fishing maintenance business. She hopes to save enough money so she can buy land in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 28 years old and operates a kiosk in the front of her house. She lives in a town near the school and her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people come to buy including students.

Julieta is requesting a loan from Tuba Rai Metin for $600, which she will use to purchase hard drinks, beer, soft drinks, water, noodles, cigarette, coffee, sugar, salt, and milk. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: to purchase hard drinks, beer, soft drinks, water, noodles, cigarette, coffee, sugar, salt, and milk.

loans.name: G.s. En Nombre De Dios Group

texts.es:
El G.S. En Nombre de Dios está conformado por tres personas dos mujeres y un hombre madres y padres responsables de ocho hijos, son originarios de Nagarote, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, Nagarote se caracteriza por su comida típica los quesillos, y por ser la ciudad más limpia de la región. Estas personas son trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la obligación de trabajar desde muy jóvenes. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Elizabeth y  tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa variada de hombre mujer y niño como pantalones, blusas, short, faldas, vestidos, camisolas, calcetines, toallas, pillamas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio y aprovechar la temporada navideña que es donde más se vende y  así en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos.  El g.s. En Nombre de Dios agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  apersonas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
G.S. En Nombre de Dios is made up of three people, two women and one man. They are responsible mothers and fathers of eight children. They originate from Nagarote, which is located in the western zone of the country. Nagarote is known for a typical dish called quesillo and for being the most clean city in the region. These people are hardworking, responsible and have great ambition. Unfortunately they were not able to study were obligated to work from a very young age.
Thanks to her strength and determination to move forward, the coordinator is Elizabeth. She sells a variety of men's, women's and children's clothes for a living like pants, blouses, shorts, skirts, dresses, camisoles, towels, and pajamas. She works in this business some 10 hours a day offering her products. The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business and take advantage of the Christmas season when sales are highest and in the not too distant future obtain better income. El G.S. En Nombre de Dios is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide people of scare resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to stock their business purchase and sale of merchandise like pants, shirts, shorts, dresses, suits,camisoles, socks, towels and pajamas.

loans.name: Izabella

texts.en:
Izabella is a married woman and has children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for her family.

She operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable vendors in her business.
 
With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit, and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For over four years, she has operated a tailoring business, making curtains and garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With this 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with one school-going child. She lives at her own house, which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothing business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Pola

texts.en:
Pola is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan of KES 60,000 to buy sacks of charcoal and bundles of firewood for her business. She is grateful for Kiva and Yehu Microfinance Trust for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and bundles of firewood for her business.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married, with two children who go to school. They live in their own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanasiti has operated a fruits and vegetable stall for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocery in the future.

With this 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a married man with eight school-aged children. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. The majority of his monthly expenses include food and school fees. 

For the past three years, he has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He mentioned seasonality and theft as his major challenges. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 20,000 KES he wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to support his business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk,s oft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, bitter ball, pepper, and meat for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cow skin for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Farhia

texts.en:
Farhia is married. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water.

Farhia has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package so that he can reduce on the length of time used for cooking food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a clean cooking package from Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) to help her warm food for her customers and also for use at home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package in order to save on house cooking energy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a package of cooking gas so that he can improve on home energy

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
Su nombre es juan david, tiene una enfermedad desde los 10 años, vive con la mama, tres hermanos menores de edad, es entusiasta, activo le gusta preguntar cuando algo no le queda claro, le gusta el fútbol, no es una persona conflictiva, es serio con las cosas.
Estudia auxiliar de enfermería porque le gusta ayudar a las personas, y que gracias a la enfermedad conoce sobre las necesidades y el tema de la enfermedad, desde pequeño siempre le ha gustado la enfermería, ayudaba al abuelo con sus medicamentos, y lo ayudaba a inyectarse la insulina, desde ese momento sintió que la enfermería era lo de el, no tiene miedo delas cosas, le gusta que le digan sus errores para a si poder mejorar cada día mas, le gusta salir a colaborar y es muy atento a lo que le dicen.
La mama es la que le paga los semestres, pero necesita este convenio para que el costo del semestre no le quede tan costoso y a la mama le quede un poco mas fácil pagar mientras yo consigo un contrato de aprendizaje para poder pagar también los colegios de los hermanos. 
La meta es seguir con los estudios y ser jefe de enfermería y poder ayudar al que lo necesite.
texts.en:
Juan David has had an illness since he was 10 years old.  He lives with his mother and three siblings who are minors.  He is enthusiastic and active.  He likes to ask when something isn't clear to him.  He likes soccer.  He isn’t a confrontational person and he is serious about things. 

He is studying to be a Nursing Assistant because he likes helping people and thanks to his illness he is familiar with the subject and the hardships of having an illness.  Since childhood he has always liked nursing.  He helped his grandfather with his medications and helped him to inject insulin.  Since that time he felt that nursing was for him.  He isn’t afraid of things.  He likes being told about his mistakes so that he can improve more with each day.  He likes to go to work and he is very attentive to what he is told.

His mother pays for his semesters but he needs this help so that the cost of the semester isn’t so expensive and so that it will be a little bit easier for his mother to pay while he gets an apprenticeship in order to be able to pay the school costs of his siblings as well.  

The goal is to continue with his studies and be head of nursing and to be able to help those who need it.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package so that he can prepare healthy food

loans.name: Jabeda

texts.en:
Jabeda is 49 years old and is married to Samser, 60 years old. They live in Dhupguri with their four children. Both of them are illiterate, but can sign their names. Jabeda is a housewife and sometimes works as a daily laborer with an inconsistent income. Her husband has involved himself in farming seasonal vegetables on his own farmland. He sells the vegetables to the local market, but he is unable to earn sufficient income for his family. 

Their children also engaged themselves in agricultural work. Day by day their financial condition is going down, and they are losing their hope for being successful at meeting the family’s basic needs. 

Jabeda wishes to grow potatoes to generate more income. They have their own land and experience in the agricultural field. This is the main reason for choosing this business. She knows that as the potato cultivation is a profitable business, the whole profit will be theirs, and they shall be able to improve their financial condition. 

One fine morning, Jabeda met the field officers of Kiva’s partner, BJS, and came to know about BJS’s activities. She made the decision to take the loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes. She thinks that with the loan money, she will start her potato business, and with the profit from her business she will purchase more farmland to grow more potatoes. 

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for standing beside her to fight against poverty.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes on her own land.

loans.name: Samuth

texts.en:
Samuth is 57 years old. She is married and lives with her four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. To earn a living, all of her children are working in the hotel industry. They make an income of $11 per day to support their family. 

Due to a lack of funds, Samuth has asked for a loan of $1,500 to purchase construction materials to build a room in her house. In addition, a part of this money is to be used to pay for her child’s passport fee. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store to generate more income to stabilize her family’s livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a room in her house.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her variety store and her loan also helped in the education of her children. Her income from the business assisted their everyday expenses at home. She also has a buy and sell business for additional income. 
 
She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Luzviminda dreams to be more successful in business and hopes to buy a lot in Cavite. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business, buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell.  Gloria has been in this business for eight years.  She also earns additional income from meat vending.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle shop business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase materials for her motorcycle shop.

Amina has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from a general store.

Amina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to  purchase materials for her motorcycle shop.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 54 years old and married with six children.

Veronica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of items like coffee, eggs, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from direct selling beauty products. Veronica has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan.

Veronica aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of items like coffee, eggs, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Rubielyn

texts.en:
Rubielyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items like noodles, coffee, sugar and milk to stock and sell in her general store business.  Rubielyn has been in this business for four years.  Rubielyn earns additional income from food vending.

Rubielyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to build and expand her business in order to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like noodles, coffee, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell like snack foods, noodles, shampoo, sugar, soap, canned goods, and other groceries for her general store business.

Jeniffer has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from selling rice.

Jeniffer has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like snack foods, noodles, shampoo, sugar, soap, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Berlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Berlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business, buying and selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines.   She also earns additional income from raising goats and chickens.  Berlyn is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Berlyn has been sustaining her business activities through the previous eight loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables.

loans.name: Baby

texts.en:
Baby is 43 years old and is married with two children.

Baby works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, like snack foods, cigarettes, sugar, shampoo, soap and other groceries.

She has previously borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal. Baby aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like snack foods, cigarettes, sugar, shampoo, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María Mercedes de 32 años de edad, madre soltera con un hijo menor de edad. Es Originaria de  león, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera  y se vio en la obligación de trabajar a temprana edad. En la actualidad lucha para brindarle un futuro mejor a su hijo.

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de gaseoasas y refrescso en su casa de habitacion. Ella dedica a su negocio unas  8 horas diarias   El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta cajillas y gaseosas y refrescos naturales como pina, calala, granadia, papalla, cacao, banano con leche, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. María Mercedes agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes, 32, is a single mother with a young son. She is originally from León, located in the western part of the country. She is known for being a hard worker and a responsible person with a desire to overcome. Unfortunately, she wasn't able to study a degree and she saw the need to work at an early age. At the present time, she is striving to offer her son a better future.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to come out ahead, as an economic activity she sells soft drinks and drinks out of a room in her house. She works around 8 hours a day. 

The loan will be used to invest in working capital and provide her business with the purchase and sale of soft drinks and natural drinks such as pineapple, passion fruit, papaya, cacao, banana and milk, so that in the near future she can obtain a better income. 

Maria Mercedes is grateful to Kiva lenders for the help they offer to people of limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua, in order to have ways of earning a living with dignity.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to supply her business with soft drinks and natural drinks such as cacao, banana and milk, fruit salad, passion fruit, pineapple, and dragon fruit.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of price fluctuation in her business, but she dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is 28 years old and lives in Tulkarem.  He opened a small garage in 2010 and specializes in repairing vehicles.  This business is the only source of income for his small family. 

Tareq is satisfied with the income but he needs this youth loan to buy an awning and an air pump.  He can’t repair cars when it rains so having an awning  will enable him to service more customers and increase his income.

Tareq is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business.

loans.use: to buy an awning and air pump to repair cars in rainy weather.

loans.name: Isaballa

texts.en:
Isaballa is married and lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates a clothing business by selling clothes from her home or door-to-door in her neighborhood. A major challenge for her is a of lack of capital to use to expand her business.

The loan of 50,000 KES will enable Isaballa to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a  mother of four school-aged children. They live in their own house which has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall home-business to sell to her neighbors and customers. She faces a major business challenge of price fluctuation  and she dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a hardworking and enterprising woman who appreciates Kiva for their financial support which has enabled her to earn extra income from her green grocery shop. She used the profits to open a boutique business.

She requests a loan of 100,000 KES to purchase bales of clothing for men, women and children to sell  in her shop.

She thanks Yehu for supporting her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothing for men, women and children to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, coconuts, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, soap, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jamina

texts.en:
Jamina is a 45-year-old woman married to Nurul, 60 years old. They live in a small town, Dhupguri, in Jalpaiguri district. She is blessed with four children. All of them are now totally involved in studies. Jamina and her husband are basically illiterate and only know how to sign their names. In spite of being illiterate, they have a keen interest to give education to their children. 

Jamina herself is busy in housekeeping, while her husband makes foundations for houses in their rural area. The profit that comes from this business is not sufficient for them to cover their family expenses along with their children’s education. 

Jamina now decided to give financial support to her husband by taking the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) so that she can help her husband to buy more raw materials or supplies like wood, bamboo, straw, ropes, etc. for making firm foundations for houses. She is very much confident that she can earn more profit by increasing the quantity as well as quality of those raw materials. 

In the future, she wants to extend her business to provide her family a better pakka (concrete) house for living comfortably and to give her best to establish her children. She is very much obliged to Kiva and BJS, as they came into her life as a light of success.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like wood, bamboo, straw and ropes for making foundations for houses.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida se encuentra estudiando actualmente en campo alto auxiliar de enfermería, escogió esta carrera porque siempre le ha gustado la idea de ayudar a las personas en todo sentido.
Escogió estudiar en campo alto porque le brindo oportunidades y facilidades para comenzar con el sueño, en este momento quiere contar con kiva para poder continuar con la carrera, la verdad seria muy útil porque no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para poder continuar con esta maravillosa carrera, con el aprendizaje, no quiere dejar este sueño a la mitad del camino y con kiva puede seguir luchando por esta meta.
Tiene como propósito terminar esta fase para a si conseguir un buen empleo para poder continuar con la carrera profesional como enfermera y desde ese mismo modo realizar la especialización en dos áreas, las cuales son pediatría y ginecostetra, por ese mismo motivo la vida esta unida al cuidado y el bienestar de las personas que lo necesitan.
Pudiendo culminar esas fases de la vida sabe que puede colaborar y ayudar a la familia económicamente, en la salud y cuidado que le pueda brindar diariamente.
Esta carrera es una de las mas duras, pero como recompensa es una de las mas hermosas porque va a vivir y compartir historias el día a día incomparables e inolvidables.
Carrera como esta ninguna, y por eso esta luchando por seguir con la carrera.
texts.en: Adelaida is currently studying to be a nurse at Campo Alto. She chose this field because she has always liked the idea of helping people, and chose to study at Campo Alto because they gave her an opportunity and assistance to start down the path towards her dream. Right now she wants to count on Kiva so that she can continue her studies. It really would be very useful because she doesn't have the resources necessary to continue in this amazing field and doesn't want to abandon her dream at the half-way mark. Together with Kiva she can continue striving for this goal. Her objective is to complete this phase and obtain a good job so she can continue with the nursing profession and specialize in two areas, namely pediatrics and OB-GYN. That way her life would be linked with the care and wellness of people who need it. After finishing these stages she knows she will be able to help her family financially, and healthwise because of the daily care she could provide. This is one of the most difficult fields of study, but also one of the most rewarding because she would be a part of incomparable and unforgettable stories every day. There's no other field like this one, and that's why she's striving to stick with it.

loans.use: To pay tuition for the semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package in order to keep her house and clothes clean

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita is 31 years old, married and a mother of five children (four sons and one daughter). She lives with her husband and children. Both Namita and her husband, Subhas, aged 48 years, are uneducated, and can only sign their names. Three of their children are students; one is in primary level, and the other two are in secondary level. They live in the small village North Khagrabari in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Both the husband and wife are engaged in the business of supplying sand and stones to the building contractor. Sand and stones are required at the time of construction of a building. They set up this business with a lot of effort. Both of them strive to get along in life and live a decent life.

They need to expand their business so as to generate more income to maintain the expenses of their family, which are growing day by day.

Namita asked for a loan from BJS to purchase more sand and stones to expand their business. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will further improve in the business and achieve her goals of giving financial support to her family and educating her children properly in the future.

She gives her full thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase sand and stone for expanding the business.

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Pratima is married and a rural housewife.  She is from the small village of West Tekatuli in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married to Kallan, and together they are raising their only son. He is receiving education and is in grade 3. Both Pratima and her husband have primary education.

Pratima's husband is engaged in a business of selling wood. He is very hardworking and enterprising and wishes to get ahead in life. He works hard to collect wood from his village and from the neighboring villages. He sells the wood to the carpenters. In this way, he earns money for his family.  

Pratima also helps him in his work after managing her household work. But the earnings are not sufficient to give financial sustenance to the family. They want to expand their business, which they cannot do because of a lack of resources.

Pratima has taken a loan to help her husband to purchase wood for his business. Her dreams are to upgrade their poor financial condition, well-educate her son and enhance her business for a secured future.

She gives her thanks to the lenders (BJS and Kiva) to help her to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase wood for expanding the existing business of supplying wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package so that she can cook cleanly.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coconuts, dried meat, and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Group 15 - An Thanh 01

texts.en: Luom is 40 years old. Currently, Luom and her husband work in agricultural production with a total monthly income of approximately 1,400,000 VND. They have two children: one grown-up and one is attending secondary school. Luom and her husband are living in a house with the paternal parents who are old and often get sick. She has to support them financially. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1990. Like other members of her group, due to economic hardship, her family is currently using a double-pit latrine which is now degraded. With a portion of this loan, Luom will be able to build a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. Those facilities would also help her family improve their health and living conditions, as well as afford safety for them, particularly at night and during rainstorms. In addition, the facilities will provide convenience, cleanliness, and privacy for all family members, while contributing to the environmental protection of the community. In the picture, Luom is the first from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package in order to save on the costs of running her salon

loans.name: Alimaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Alimaa, 53 years old, lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, and grandson in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been renting out a restaurant for living, and almost two years ago she decided to run photography shop. Now her photography business is almost meeting its second year and she has amassed quite a lot of experience regarding this business. 

She is requesting a loan of 1500000 MNT to buy a printer, frames, and colored paper. As a result, she can continue to run her business without any inventory shortage.

loans.use: to buy a printer, frames, and colored paper.

loans.name: Samet

texts.en:
Samet is 58 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in agricultural business for more than ten years. She has an extensive experience and is successful in her business. Specifically, she grows rice. She makes an income of $6 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. 

To improve her family’s finances, Samet is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a cow to breed and produce calves to sell. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn higher education. Moreover, she wants to rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to breed and produce calves to sell.

loans.name: Enkhmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhmaa, 47 years old, lives with her husband and children in Kherlen, an easternmost town of Mongolia. The family resides in an old, wooden house on a plot of land. She and her husband raise livestock and sell diary products for a living. Her main job is to make diary products out of milk and, after that, her husband sells them at the market. Also, her husband renders taxi services for additional income. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some serious repair. So, Enkhmaa is requesting a loan of MNT 1,500,000 to buy building and insulation materials, such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam. 

Using those materials, she will repair and insulate her house, thus creating a comfortable and warm place for her family. Also, the renovated house will require less burning of coal for heating, which will have a positive impact on efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia tiene 64 años de edad vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Tienen una bodeguita donde ofrecen productos de primera necesidad, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2500 nuevos soles para la compra de abarrotes arroz, aceites, azúcar, harinas entre otros y así abastecer su negocio con la compra de más mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Emilia, age 64, lives with her husband in the Zaña district.  The population there works in agriculture, commerce, and with livestock.  It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

They have a small grocery store where they sell basic needs products.  Her business is located in the back part of her house.  

She has requested a loan for 2,500 soles to buy groceries like rice, cooking oil, sugar, and flour, among others.  This way she will stock her business with the purchase of more merchandise to offer her customers.  She will be generating greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her business.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
This is Elsie. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy load wallets and SIM cards for mobile phones to sell in her store. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a mini variety store and sells processed foods for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy load wallets and SIM cards for mobile phones to sell in her store. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

She hopes to be more successful in business and dreams of giving her child a good education. She meets up with her fellowship members every week to share stories of their work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for load wallets and SIM cards for mobile phones to sell in her store.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobo, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, vacas y venta de animales menores chivos y cerdos desde hace 5 años , por lo que es conocida en la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para el ganado vacuno y de esta manera tener una mejor producción de leche para ofrecer en el mercado de la zona, generando ingresos mayores para su familia.
texts.en:
Adriana is 41 years old and lives with her family in the Buenos Aires district, known for its carob trees.  It’s residents are farmers, merchants, and raise livestock.  It’s located two hours from the city of Piura, in the northern coast of Peru.

She raises cattle and sells small animals, goats, and pigs and has done so for five years, for which she is known in the area.  She is asking for a loan of 1,000 New Soles to buy feed for her cattle so she can increase her milk production to sell in the local market, generating greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jean works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and fruits. 

Jean is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past 31 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Jovita works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling cashew nuts. 

Jovita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, milk, sweet potato, etc for her food vending business.

Jovita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, milk, sweet potato, etc.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing maintenance business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fishing net and other fishing materials for her fishing maintenance business.

Marilou has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Erma works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from a boarding house. Erma is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks for her general store business, like soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, and eggs.

Erma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could have her own land.

loans.use: to buy more stocks, like soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, and eggs.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Veronica works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. 

Veronica is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc. for her general store business.

Veronica has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 61 years old, widowed, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from buy-and-sell charcoal. 

Lourdes is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional vegetables to sell through her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Conchita works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. 

Conchita is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables for her business to sell.

Conchita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can buy house and lot.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Febronia is a married woman in her late 40s with two children.  Her son and daughter are in school. 

For the past eleven years, she has been involved with a retail shop business to sell items like dry food, cooking oil, sweets, kerosine,and soaps etc. 

Febronia works daily from 8:30am to 11:00pm and is able to earn a small monthly profit. 

This is her eighth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to restock out-of-stock products to resell. Her business is not yet grown to the level that yields a satisfactory returns.  Febronia repaid her previous loans and used them to buy new and sold-out products in order to meet her daily customer demands.  She reinvested her profit to expand the business and pay school fees and home expenses.

She is a hard worker and is thankful for your support.  Febronia dreams of opening another shop. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "TUPENDANE" which has 2 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock out-of-stock products.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a married woman, with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mercedes is 54 years old and has one child who is in school.

Mercedes has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Mercedes has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Dionisia requested a PHP 21,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Dionisia has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman, with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Erlinda is 52 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Erlinda has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 28 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Bidala

texts.en: Bidala appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her restaurant business and earn a higher income that she used for her personal expenditures. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more stock of rice, wheat flour, charcoal, onions, tomatoes, tea leaves, and sugar. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, wheat flour, charcoal, onions, tomatoes, tea leaves and sugar.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall home-business to sell food to her neighbors and community. She faces a major business challenge of price fluctuation and she dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

She will use the 20,000 KES to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 58 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like canned goods, candles, cooking oil, coffee, sugar and other groceries to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 19 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, candles, cooking oil, coffee, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Binti

texts.en: This is Binti. She previously accessed a loan that she used to buy khangas for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures. Beside the khanga selling business, Binti sells dumplings. She is requesting for a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and sugar. She appreciates Kiva for their financial support. The profit from her business will definitely help her to provide for her daily needs. Binti looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and sugar for her dumpling selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag and water by the sack for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plantains, flour, eddoe, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Edis Suyapa

texts.es: Edis, tiene 41 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta básica desde hace 2 años, en busca de obtener ingresos para su familia. Vende arroz, manteca, azúcar, verduras, refrescos, maíz, pan, condimentos, churros, sal etc.  Ha obtenido varios préstamos para invertir en su negocio. Actualmente solicita otro por 15,000 Lempiras para surtir de productos básicos como granos básicos, carnes, verduras, refrescos, huevos, pan, manteca y otros, con el fin de aumentar las ventas en esta temporada de Diciembre. Tiene  como meta hacer su negocio más grande  y tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edis is 41 years old. She lives in a common law relationship with her husband. They have three children and live in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. 

She has been engaged in selling staple food items for two years in order to earn income for her family. She sells rice, butter, sugar, vegetables, soft drinks, corn, bread, condiments, fried pastry sticks, salt, etc.

She has obtained several loans for investment in her business. Currently she is asking for another 15,000 lempiras to stock basic products such as basic grains, meat, vegetables, soft drinks, eggs, bread, butter, and more, in order to increase sales around the December season. 

Her goal is to have a larger business and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock food products such as basic grains, meat, vegetables, soft drinks, eggs, bread, butter and other items to sell

loans.name: Shampa

texts.en: Shampa is a 26-year-old housewife who is married to Prasanta, 41 years old. Their only son is studying in class V (grade 5). She has completed class VIII standard (grade 8) but her husband is illiterate. Throughout the day, she manages all the household work and her husband keeps himself busy selling grocery items from his grocery shop. Shampa wishes to extend this business because their grocery shop is in great demand in her area. There is only one shop in the village of Baroghoria at Dhupguri where the villagers usually buy their daily grocery items. She wants to renovate their shop with more grocery items but they have no capital to meet the demands of the shop. She learned about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and requested a loan to buy more grocery items for their shop. In the future, she wants to become a good entrepreneur and improve her business gradually with the profit she can earn from the shop. She can make her concrete house more beautiful with the profit from the business. Shampa sincerely thanks BJS and Kiva for their kind support.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish, rice, oil pepper, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Lucilla

texts.en:
This is Lucila, 43, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Joseph and is a mother to her two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Lucila operates a meat stall. They buy meat from suppliers that deliver the meat to respective market stalls. Her products are chicken and pork. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of pork and chicken needed in her business.

Lucila dreams of expanding her business and hopes to give her family a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for pork and chicken meat needed for her business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina. She previously accessed a 28,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more stock of mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a variety store and a loading station for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of mineral water needed in her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Josefina dreams. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more gallons of mineral water to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Melva is 56 years old and married with ten children.

Melva works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Melva has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business selling charcoal for 5 years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Melva aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 64 years old and married with ten children. Melinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal in the Philippines and has been in this business for 9 years. She also earns an income from buying and selling young coconuts.

Melinda requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Melinda has borrowed and paid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan.

Melinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 56 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Elsa has been pig fattening for 2 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

Elsa is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Juana Luisa

texts.es:
Juana de 43 años de edad, debido a la situación económica de su familia, solo logro cursar hasta un 7º grado, y empezó a trabajar con su madre en la crianza de ganado de granja, su esposo es profesor y trabaja en un cantón cercano de su casa, sus 3 hijos están estudiando un 6º y 7º grado y una esta cursando ultimo año en la universidad.

Juana, desde que estaba muy pequeña se a dedicado a la crianza de animales de granja, ya que su madre le enseño al cuido de ellos, todos los días tiene que cuidarlos, que siempre no les falte el alimento, los que le ayudan es su hija mayor cuando regresa de la universidad.


Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados, para comprar pollos de engorde y en la compra de concentrados para la alimentación de los mismos.

Espera sacar adelante en los estudios a sus hijos menores, hasta la universidad donde a podido llegar su hija mayor, en la crianza de pollos espera para el próximo año que le ingresen mas pollos, para que tenga mejores ingresos para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Due to her family's economic situation, Juana, 43 years old, was only able to study until the 7th grade. She then began working with her mother raising farm animals. Her husband is a teacher and works in a canton close to their house. Her 3 children are studying in the 6th and 7th grades, and one is in her final year in university.

Juana, since she was very young, has spent her time raising farm animals. Since her mother taught her how to care for them, she has had to care for them everyday, making sure they have enough food. Her oldest daughter helps her when she returns from university.

The funds from the loan will be used to buy chickens for fattening, and to purchase chicken feed for these chickens. She hopes to get her younger children to university, as far as her oldest daughter has studied.

In raising chickens, she will wait until next year to get more chickens, so that she can have better earnings for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten and chicken feed.

loans.name: Dinora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dinora de 50 años de edad, debido a la economía de su familia, solo pudo estudiar hasta un 6º  grado; ya que tenia que trabajar con su padre y su madre quienes se dedicaban a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado, sus hijos todos son mayores de edad  2 de ellos ya tienen su propia familia y dos de ellas están con ella. Su esposo, se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado de repasto.

Ella  se a dedicado a trabajar toda su vida, cuando empezó con sus padres luego una amiga le manifestó la compra y venta de ropa y empezó con este negocio y ayudandole a su esposo en los gastos familiares. Con mucho esfuerzo en el tiempo logro conseguir un puesto de venta en el mercado municipal, empezó con poca venta ya que se le hacia difícil el mantenerla.

 Hoy en día trabaja todos los días, tiene que trasladarse desde su casa a su negocio son 7 kilómetros, dos en ocasiones tiene que caminar o pagar una mototaxi para que la lleve hacia la ciudad, donde aborda un autobús que la conduce al puesto de trabajo, esto lo hace a diario y tiene que madrugar para estar a tempranas horas abriendo el negocio y cierra a las 5 de la tarde, donde tiene que hacer el mismo recorrido hacia su casa.

Los fondos del crédito, serán utilizados para la compra de ropa y para fortalecer mas el negocio que tiene en el mercado municipal.

Los sueños que tiene a futuro, es poder lograr comprar otro local; ya que quiere que su hija quien le gusta este negocio lo pueda desempeñar, con las ganancias va aumentando la mercadería
texts.en:
Dinora, 50, was only able to finish sixth grade and had to begin farming and raising livestock with her father and mother because of the family's financial situation. Her children are now grown; two have families of their own and two live with her. Her husband farms and raises grazing animals. 

Dinora has worked all her life. She started working with her parents. Later a friend showed her how to sell clothing, and she started this business to help her husband with the household expenses. Over time and with hard work, she set up a stall in the city market. Sales were slow at first, and it was hard to keep the business going. Now she works every day and has to get to her business, which is seven kilometers from her house. Sometimes she walks, and other times she takes a taxi to the city, where she boards a bus to get to work. She has to get up at dawn each day to open the business early in the morning. She closes at 5:00 p.m. to return home.

She will use the loan to buy clothing to stock her business at the city market. She dreams of one day having another stall so that her daughter, who likes the business, could run it. She will use her profit to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothing to stock her business at the city market.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production and vending business. Nancy has been in this business for 10 years and she earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her business buying and selling vegetables. Elisa has been in this business for 20 years. Elisa earns more income from farming vegetables.

Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her business buying and selling rice. Elvira has been in this business for 5 years, and she earns more income from farming rice.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Tunaweza Group

texts.en:
Dorina is a married woman in her mid thirties with two school-aged boys.  She has run a beauty salon for six years and works from 8:00am to 11:00pm to make a small monthly profit.

This is her third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to buy cosmetics and hair products.  Dorina successfully repaid her previous loans and used them to restock her beauty salon.  Dorina used her business profit to pay school fees and cover home food expenses. She dreams of opening a retail shop. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "TUNAWEZA" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair products for her business.

loans.name: Parachichi Group

texts.en:
Almas is in his early 40s and is married with one school-aged child.  He has been a food vendor for five years.  He works daily from 7:00am to 8.30pm and is able to make a  monthly profit.

This will be his 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to start a charcoal selling business and continue his fruit and vegetable business.
