He has successfully paid back his loans.  He used the profit to pay for school fees, cover household expenses and buy small items for his business.  He will use this loan to buy popular fruit and vegetables and sacks of charcoal to resell. 

He dreams of making his business international.

Almas will share this loan with his loan group "PARACHICHI" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy popular fruit and vegetables and sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Ma. Christina

texts.en:
Ma. Christina is 49 years old and has six children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Ma. Christina is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for three years now and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She has now requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy food and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Christina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy food and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Marina has been in this business for 15 years now.

Marina requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear items to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Marina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear items to sell.

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en:
Simplicia works hard to support her family. Simplicia is married and has a sugarcane farming business in the Philippines.

Simplicia requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Simplicia has been in this business for seven years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Simplicia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma appreciates her previous loan. It improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of KSHS 30,000 to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, salt, rice and sugar. She thanks Yehu for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, salt, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maribeth is 43 years old and has five children who are still in school.

Maribeth has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers.

In the future, Maribeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Evilla

texts.en:
Evilla works hard to support her family. Evilla is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Evilla requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Evilla has been in this business for five years now.

Evilla would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Lydia requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional ingredients for her business, like cooking oil, bananas, flour, and sugar.

Lydia has been in this business for 15 years now. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business, like cooking oil, bananas, flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Menuri

texts.en:
Menuri appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. 

She is requesting for a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. 

She thanks Yehu Microfinance Trust for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Marco, tiene 48 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. Hace 4 años que se dedica a la venta de banano verde, repollo, papas, tomate, y otras verduras. Este negocio lo realiza en forma ambulante, movilizándose a varias comunidades en un vehículo.  Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo el cual es por 25,000 lempiras para comprar mas verduras como bananos, repollo, tomate, papas etc. para vender y poder mejorar las ventas e ingresos. Como su meta es sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles una buena educación.
texts.en:
Señor Marco is 48 years old and is married.  He has three children and lives in the town of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.  He has always worked in trade.  

For four years he has worked selling green bananas, cabbage, potatoes, tomatoes, and other produce.  He carries out his business as a mobile vendor, visiting various neighborhoods in a vehicle.  He has asked for a second loan of 25,000 lempiras to buy more produce such as bananas, cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes, etc., to sell.  

He wants to able to improve his sales and income, because his goal to get his children ahead and give them a good education.

loans.use: to buy produce to sell such as bananas, cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more plantain to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more red oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the package of cooking gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 57, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Leve and a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household, while operating a business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Nenita maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct-selling brands, like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct-selling brands. 

A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s costs are lower than those in the catalog and the difference represents the profit that dealers are counting on as their income. 

Nenita's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, Nenita is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products, like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other products needed in her business.

Nenita dreams to add another business and hopes to have a better living. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products, like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing maintenance business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years and earns more income from pre-paid mobile loading.

Leny is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing maintenance business.

Leny has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing maintenance business in the Philippines. Venancia has been in this business for 5 years and earns more income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes.

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing maintenance business.

Venancia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sacks of rice for her business buying and selling rice. Edna has been in this business for 3 years, and she earns more income from farming rice.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Miladis Yamilet

texts.es:
Miladis de 34 años de edad, se a dedicado a trabajar en el comercio informal, desde muy pequeña en compañía de su madre; ya que se dedicaba a esta actividad, la que le ayuda en el negocio es su hija mayor y su esposo es policía.


Ella  desde muy joven se a dedicado a trabajar en el comercio, con su madre; quien se dedicaba al comercio informal, luego cuando se caso empezó a trabajar por su cuenta y empezó en la venta ambulante de ropa. Luego con el tiempo pudo establecer su propio local en la ciudad, pero no se quedo con ese poco ingreso, se dedico a la venta de tortillas todos los días  tiene que madrugar, ya que su casa esta a 3 kilómetros de donde tiene el negocio y el bus que ingresa a ese lugar solo hace un viaje por la mañana y las 7 de la mañana ingresa a la ciudad y el regreso es por la tarde.


Los fondos del crédito, serán utilizados para  remodelar la casa, comprar puertas de metal y arreglo de las paredes de la casa

Los sueños que tiene a futuro, es poder sacar adelante en los estudios de sus hijos y si fuese posible hasta la universidad, y ampliar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Miladis, 34, worked from an early age with her mother and older sister in informal commerce. Her husband is a police officer. She began working in business informally with her mother as a youngster. When she married, she started working on her own, selling clothing as a street vendor. Over time, she managed to open a stall in the local market, but she didn't earn much. She then sold tortillas every day. She has to get up very early because her business is now three kilometers from her house. The bus that takes her to work only makes one morning trip, at 7:00 a.m., to the city. She returns home in the afternoon. 

She will use the loan to remodel her house, buy metal doors, and repair the walls. She dreams of educating her children, hopefully through college, and growing her business.

loans.use: to remodel her house, buy metal doors, and repair the walls.

loans.name: Navigator Group

texts.en:
Pili, a business woman who has been running a charcoal and tailoring business for five years, is in her mid-30s and has four children, all of whom are in school. Working from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily, she has the capacity to make a good profit. 

This is Pili's fifth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans, all fully repaid, to increase her stocks of charcoal; profits were applied to school fees and household expenses. She will use this loan to buy business tailoring materials and sacks of charcoal to resell. Her dream is to buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business. 

Pili will share this loan with her group, "Navigator," which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy business tailoring materials and sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Muheza Group

texts.en:
Scola is in her early forties and is single with one child who is still in school. She has been running a grocery store for two years now. She works from 12 noon to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Scola's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy beer, soda, water, juice, and spirits for grocery stock. She has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to again buy beer, soda, water, juice, and spirits for the grocery stock. Scola dreams of opening another grocery store in a different place. She appreciates whomever has supported her group to make progress.

Scola will share this loan with her loan group Muheza with four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda, water, juice, and spirits for grocery stock.

loans.name: Pwani Group

texts.en:
Kulwa, who is in her early forties, is married and has four children who are in school. For twelve years now, Kulwa has managed her family by having three small businesses: a retail shop, a charcoal selling business, and a firewood business. She starts her businesses from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm per working day and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This is Kulwa's tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to restock her retail shop with new and sold-out products. She also bought more firewood and sacks of charcoal. She is really appreciative of Tujijenge's loan support which has helped her businesses to expand. Kulwa has managed to pay back all her previous loans successfully. She used her profit to cover school fees and household expenses. She also used part of her profit to proceed on building. Kulwa will use this loan to buy out-of-stock products for her retail shop and buy sacks of charcoal and firewood to resell. She dreams to finish building her house. 

Kulwa will share this loan with her loan group Pwani which totals seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy out-of-stock products for her retail shop and buy sacks of charcoal and firewood to resell.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is 29 years old. She lives in Gaza with her husband and her four children. She has a shop where she rents dresses and operates a beauty salon. She opened her business more than eight years ago and it helped with the family income because her husband works as a taxi drive and earns only a small salary. They are a big family and need to take care of their kids.

Manal asked Ryada for this youth loan to build an attic to store the dresses and to redecorate her shop in order to increase her stock. She is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve her goals. Her dream is to be well known in the city so she tries to give the best service to her clients 
. 
Manal is very grateful to everyone who helps her. Her husband appears in the photo. For cultural reasons, she can’t publish her photos online, so she apologies.

loans.use: to build a storage area and redecorate her store

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 52 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marina has a cocoa vending business in the Philippines. Marina requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her business. She has been in this business for 8 years. Marina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda works hard to support her family. She is single and has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now.

Yolanda requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear items to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear items to sell.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
This is Habiba. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more items for her beauty salon. She has been in this business for over three years now, and it keeps on growing. 

She would like to apply for a loan of 20,000 KSHS to buy more stock of shampoo, hair oil, hair conditioners, and braids for her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. 

Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the family's expenses.. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more beauty supplies for her salon

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jennifer is 29 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Jennifer has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines. Jennifer requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dry goods like slippers, knives, blouses, etc. to sell.

Jennifer has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package that will allow her to cook meals quickly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package

loans.name: Khulan

texts.en:
Mrs. Khulan, who is 23 years old, lives with her husband in a house on plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as an environmentalist at a mining company for eleven months. 

Her husband recently filled out job application for a pizza delivery company, and the company requested him to own an automobile for delivery. So she is requesting a loan of MNT 8,000,000 to buy an electric car for her husband. 

The advantage of electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities because it produces no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from the onboard source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. 

Her husband has no particular profession.  The pizza delivery job is ideal for him as Mongolian economy today faces difficulties, and unemployment is high. If she and her husband both work, it is easier to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy an electric car so her husband can get a delivery job.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es:
Sarita tiene 33años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el Caserío de Culpon una zona rural de Nueva Arica, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de combustible gasolina y gas, abasteciendo en su gran mayoría a los pobladores de su caserío, tiene un buen posicionamiento en la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para incrementar su negocio con la compra de balones de gas y de esta manera atender a la demanda en la zona, generando, mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Saritais 33 years old and lives with her son in the Culpon settlement, located in the rural Nueva Arica zone, where its residents are farmers, merchants, and raise livestock.  It’s located two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru. 

She sells fuel; gasoline and gas and supplies most of the local population.  She is well positioned in her area and is asking for a loan of 1,500 New Soles so she can expand her business by buying gas cylinders so she can meet the local demand and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
Aydee tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en el distrito de La Matanza, es una comunidad tranquila, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Con la ayuda de su esposo Aydee se dedica al a venta de cerveza en su domicilio, desde hace tres años tienen una clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de gaseosas, vinos, y champagne para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Aydee is 52 years old and lives with her husband and children in the La Matanza district.  This is a tranquil community and its population are farmers, merchants, and raise livestock.  It’s located two hours from the city of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

She and her husband sell beers from her home.  She’s been doing this for three years and has a considerable number of customers.  She is asking for a loan of 1,000 New Soles to buy soft drinks, wines, and champagne to offer her customers and be able to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
As the married parent of six children, Jovita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from manicure/pedicure.  

Jovita is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, spices, noodles, coffee, sugar, etc., for her general store business.

Jovita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, spices, noodles, coffee, sugar, etc

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As the married parent of three children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a business making dried fish in the Philippines, and she also earns income from food vending.  

Gloria is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to process to dried fish for her fish business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to process to dried fish

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 43 years old and married, with two children, who are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items, to sell like canned goods, snack foods, soap, shampoo, noodles, biscuits, etc.

Erlinda has been in this business for seven years.

In the future Erlinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, soap, shampoo, noodles, biscuits, etc

loans.name: Socrates

texts.en:
Mr. Socrates is an entrepreneur that lives on the remote island of Papua, Indonesia.  He tells why he needs this KIVA loan in its own words: 

"[My] business started as one kiosk in the city of Manokwari and one kiosk in a nearby village.  I am now in the beginning stages of opening two more kiosks in two other villages in the next several months, so that those villages can also have access to clean and affordable drinking water.

In the province of West Papua, Indonesia, very few people have access to drinking water that is both safe AND affordable.  Many people are forced either to purchase bottled water that is very expensive or boil their own water which also is expensive, labor-intensive, and pollutes the environment.  In the areas far from the city, because boiling water requires so much work, many people risk drinking untreated water and, as a result, continually suffer from water-borne illnesses. Nazava’s water filtration technology provides a superior alternative in its simple design, affordability, and ability to produce safe drinking water. My business’s primary goal is to actively portray Jesus Christ’s love for all people by caring for the physical needs of the people of West Papua via:

1.	Providing a safe, affordable, and practical clean drinking water solution to the communities throughout Papua Barat.
2.	Teaching and equipping other aspiring Papuan entrepreneurs how to open their own kiosks in their villages and how to run a successful kiosk business selling the Nazava filters.

Because the demand for the Nazava filters is so high, I have trouble keeping sufficient stock to meet the demand.  I do not charge a high profit margin, which makes it difficult to increase my business’ inventory.  This loan will allow me to increase my inventory and minimize the time I am out of stock and cannot serve the local community."

loans.use: to provide a safe, affordable, and practical clean drinking water solution to the communities throughout Papua Barat

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. She earns additional income from motorcycle transport and raising livestock.

Marilyn is requesting a loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to buy soap, shampoo, spices, chips, bread, etc. for her general store.  She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase soap, shampoo, spices, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Kanysh

texts.ru: Каныш 30 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Каныш - средне-специальное образование, основной деятельностью семьи Каныш является сельское хозяйство, а именно: животноводство и полеводство, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Каныш, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, 1 бычок, а также Каныш параллельно занимается полеводством, имеет 2,70 ГА поливной земли. На указанных землях семья Каныш выращивает фасоль, кукурузу и клевер. Во избежание падежа скота Каныш два раз в год проводит ветеринарные мероприятия. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Каныш обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Каныш планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Kanysh is 30 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising two children. Kanysh has a specialized high school education. Agriculture is the main activity of Kanysh's family, specifically raising livestock and crops, having started 10 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 5,000 som KGS.

Thanks to her hard work, Kanysh today has on her homestead: one dairy cow, one horse, and one steer. Kanysh is also engaged in parallel in agriculture and has 2.70 hectares of arable land. On these lands, Kanysh's family grows beans, corn and clover. To avoid loss of cattle, Kanysh twice a year conducts veterinary activities. Monthly income consists of 13,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Kanysh turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy cows for expanding the headcount of livestock.

Kanysh plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of domestic animals, and plans to save money for the further education of her children.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Kura

texts.en:
This is Kura. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to purchase more garments for her business.

She would like to apply for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy more stock of clothes. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs.

She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Group 13 - An Thanh 01

texts.en: Ms Tiep, 38, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of approximately VND 700,000. Her husband died from an electrical shock accident and she has to bring up two small children on her own. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1999. Because of the economic hardships, her family is currently using a double-pit latrine that has degraded and has the risks of potential adverse affects to the health of her family members and her community and environment contamination. With a portion of this loan, she will be able to buy materials to build a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. Those facilities would also help her family improve their health and living conditions and afford safety for them, particularly at night and during rainstorms. The facilities would provide convenience, cleanliness and privacy for all family members, while contributing to the environment protection of the community. In the picture, Ms Tiep is standing in the second row, third from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cooking gas packages that she can sell to her community

loans.name: Jorge Daniel

texts.es: Jorge, tiene 24 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 1 hijo  y vive en el municipio de  Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Siempre se ha dedicado a  la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz, frijoles y café y  hace dos años cultiva plátano.  Esta producción es vendida en la zona donde reside. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 15,000 lempiras para pago de limpieza y siembra de más plátano, con el propósito de ampliar el área de cultivo. Tiene como meta seguir cultivando para obtener los ingresos necesarios para darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is 24 and lives with his common-law wife, with whom he has one child. He lives in the town of
Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. He has always worked in agriculture, growing maize, beans and coffee, and he has been growing bananas for two years. This crop is sold in the area where he lives. He is asking for a loan of 15,000 Honduran lempiras to pay for the land to be cleared and for more banana to be sown, with the goal of increasing his area for growing produce. His goal is to continue growing crops in order to earn the necessary income to provide a better quality of life for himself and for his family.

loans.use: to pay for land to be cleared and for more banana plants to be sown.

loans.name: Ramala

texts.en:
Ramala is a 40-year-old woman from a rural village, Sahapara, in Moynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She attended school up to grade 7. Her husband, Haren, aged 45 years, is illiterate and can only sign his name. They live in their own kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo) with their two daughters, who are students. (One is in college, and the other is in grade 9.)

Ramala is a hardworking entrepreneur who struggles to give her children everything they need so they lack for nothing. Ramala and her husband both are engaged in a business of making 'bori' (a conical ball made of pulp used in vegetables curry in India). They sell the products in the local market and to their neighbours, relatives and friends and earn for their family. They are working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Yet their income is too low to give sufficient financial sustenance to their family.

Ramala requested a loan from BJS to purchase additional ingredients for their product in order to expand their business. She expects a boost in her business income from it.

Ramala dreams to be more profitable in business and hopes to have a comfortable life, and at the same time to be able to give a good education and better future for her daughters and further expand her business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for expanding the existing business of making 'bori' (a conical ball made of pulses pulp used in India).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for cooking gas so he can prepare breakfast and eat a warm meal at night

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Originally from Kampong Thom province, Vanna is a mother of five kids. Currently, she needs to support two kids who remain in school. To cover their daily expenses, she sells rice and porridge while her husband works at a local organization to earn additional income. She has been involved in her current business for four years.  This is the fifth loan for Vanna with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans that she has repaid back with success have enabled her to improve her lifestyle. Now, she is seeking a new loan to pay for her son’s short course in telephone repair skills. She hopes that her son can complete this course successfully and learn a specific skill so that he can run a small shop to earn more income to support the family.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s vocational training

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package so that he can save money

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
This is Melinda. She previously obtained a PHP 40,000 loan that she used for the salaries of the employees and teachers and to pay for the maintenance of her school. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for the salaries of the employees and teachers and for the maintenance of the school. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Melinda dreams of being successful in her business and hopes that her family will have its own house and lot. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay salaries of teachers and employees and pay for school maintenance.

loans.name: Beverlyn

texts.en:
Beverlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish like lapu-lapu, tilapia, bangus, etc. to sell in her fish business.

Beverlyn has been in this business for two years. Beverlyn earns additional income from farming rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Beverlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish like lapu-lapu, tilapia and bangus to sell.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
As the married parent of four children, Mary Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from motorcycle transport.  

Mary Joy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell, like canned goods, spices, soap, shampoo, etc., for her general store business.

Mary Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell, like canned goods, spices, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 48 years old and married with three children.

Natividad works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soft drinks, chips, canned goods, etc.

Natividad has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Natividad aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soft drinks, chips and canned goods.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Analyn is 30 years old and has one child who is in school.

Analyn has a rope making business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for making rope.

Analyn has been in this business for two years. Analyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for making rope.

loans.name: Babylyn

texts.en:
Babylyn is 30 years old and married with one child.

Babylyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, chips, spices, soft drinks, etc.

Babylyn has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

Babylyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, chips, spices and soft drinks.

loans.name: Analyne

texts.en:
Analyne is 35 years old and married with two children.

Analyne works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like canned goods, noodles, coffee, snack foods and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Analyne has borrowed and paid back two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns additional income from food-vending.

Analyne aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like canned goods, noodles, coffee, snack foods and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

Carmelita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Carmelita has been in this business for 15 years now and she earns additional income from farming rice. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 38 years old and married, with five children.

She earns a living by farming and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Edna is borrowing PHP 17,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional seedlings for her farm.

Edna has been farming and selling vegetables for 25 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Andrés Ramiro

texts.es: Andrés, un joven de 27 años de edad, movido por la necesidad de ayudar a su padre en su sostenimiento, y salir adelante, tomó la decisión de abrir una tienda hace pocos meses, desde la que ofrece surtido en dulces y gaseosas actualmente. Su objetivo es poder ampliar su inventario para atraer un mayor número de clientes a su negocio, por lo que requiere el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (lácteos, granos, galletería, pastas, gaseosas, dulces, cholate, azúcar, productos de aseo, entre otros), así podrá ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes y generará mejores ingresos económicos. Su gran sueño es llegar a tener un mini mercado desde donde pueda generar los recursos que él y su familia necesitan, y también generar empleo e ingresos para otras personas que como el tanto lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Andrés is a 27-year-old man who is motivated by the need to help support his father and to improve his financial situation.  He decided a few months ago to open a shop, from which he currently sells sweets and soft drinks.  His goal is to be able to expand his inventory and attract a greater number of customers to his business.  For this he needs a loan, so that he can buy merchandise at wholesale, such as dairy products, grains, pastas, cookies, candy, chocolate, sugar, soft drinks and cleaning supplies.  This will enable him to offer a greater variety of products to his customers and to increase his income.

His greatest dream is to have a mini-market from which he can generate all of the income that he and his family need, and to create jobs and income for other people who also need work.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale, such as dairy products, grains, pastas, cookies, candy, chocolate, sugar, soft drinks and cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food-cooking stocks of rice, beans, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ustawi Group

texts.en:
Asteria is in her mid-thirties and married with four children; three of them are in school, while the youngest stays home. She has been a tailor since 1994. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Asteria’s tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania; she successfully paid off the prior loans. She used the previous loans to buy two specialized sewing machines and material for making dresses and suits. She used her profits to pay school fees, cover household expenses and start building her house.

Asteria is applying for 4,390,000 TZS to be apportioned among her loan group members (the five will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan). With her portion she will buy more material to make dresses and suits and to start selling fabric, sarongs and shoes. Her goal is to finish building her house.

loans.use: buy more material to make dresses and suits and to start selling fabric, sarongs and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dried fish for her business

loans.name: Sara Emilia

texts.es:
Sara es madre soltera de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo y dedicación. A sus 56 años de edad, se encuentra realizando un curso de bisutería que ofrece la alcaldía del municipio donde reside a un grupo de adultos mayores, allí vio la oportunidad de iniciar su propio negocio de venta de accesorios de bisutería; razón por la cual se motiva para solicitar el apoyo del crédito. Con el dinero comprará insumos al por mayor (pedrería, nylon elástico, broches, cadenas, entre otros), esto le permitirá poner en marcha su proyecto productivo con el que espera generar recursos para el sustento de su hogar.
Sara manifiesta que su principal desafío es diseñar productos que cautiven a sus clientes, sin embargo, no se desanima, por el contrario desea luchar para sacar adelante su actividad generadora de recursos, con la que espera poder disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida y una vejez más tranquila y sin preocupaciones monetarias.
texts.en:
Sara is a single mother of three children.  She has gotten them ahead through great effort and dedication.  At 56 years old, she completed a course in jewelry making offered by the mayor’s office in an area where a lot of older adults live.  There she saw the opportunity to start her own business selling costume jewelry accessories, which is her reason for asking for the support of this loan.  With the money she will buy supplies in bulk (gemstones, elastic cording, clasps, and chains, among others).  This will let her get her project going.  She hopes this job will generate income to support her household.

Sara states that her main challenge is designing products that grab the attention of her customers.  Nevertheless, she doesn’t get discouraged.  On the contrary, she wants to fight to get this income-making project going.  She hopes that through this job she can enjoy a better quality of life and a calmer old age without money worries.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk (gemstones, elastic cording, clasps, and chains, among others)

loans.name: Aveina

texts.en:
Aveina is a 38-year-old married woman with seven children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. 

Aveina has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, a weed-sprayer and a spade. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Aveina hopes to save for her children's education and for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, a weed-sprayer and a spade.

loans.name: Taimi

texts.en:
Taimi is a 50-year-old married woman with only one child. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 10  years. 

Taimi has requested a loan to buy taro roots, a spade, bush knives, chemicals and a weed-sprayer. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Taimi hopes to save for unexpected emergencies and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, a spade, bush knives, chemicals and a weed-sprayer.

loans.name: Norbil

texts.es:
Norbil tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el Distrito de Santo Tomas, una comunidad acogedora, con impresionantes paisajes por su relieve accidentado le ha permitido tener zonas de diversos cultivos como café, frutales, papas, yucas entre otros, ubicado a cinco horas de la Provincia de Cutervo, Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta y reparación de celulares, cuenta con clientela considerable ya que no hay mayor competencia en el distrito, también brinda servicio de albañilería.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para implementar su negocio con la compra de accesorios, cargadores, baterías, chips y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Norbil, 28, lives with his wife and child in the Santo Tomás district, located five hours from the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.  It's a welcoming community with impressive landscapes because of the rugged geography that has created areas for a variety of crops, including coffee, fruit trees, and yuca.

Norbil makes a living selling and repairing mobile phones.  He has a lot of customers because there's not a lot of competition in the district.  He also offers construction services.

He has requested a loan for 3,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to set up his business and buy accessories, chargers, batteries, and chips.  This way he can serve his customers and earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories

loans.name: Aneceta

texts.en:
Aneceta works hard to support her family. Aneceta is married and has a business buying and selling goods in the Philippines.

Aneceta requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of goods like belts, towels, shorts, blouses, etc. to sell.

Aneceta has been in this business for two years now.

Aneceta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of goods like belts, towels, shorts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Erna Leigh

texts.en:
Erna Leigh is 21 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Erna Leigh has a rice mill operator business in the Philippines. Erna Leigh requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts to do the maintenance of her rice mill.

Erna Leigh has been in this business for two years. In the future, Erna Leigh would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her rice mill.

loans.name: Ardakbubu

texts.ru: Ардакбубу 52 года, вдова, однам воспитывает 4 детей. В прошлом году в агусте месяце у Ардакбубу умер супруг от тяжелой болезни. Тяжело пережив смерть любимого супруга Ардакбубу взяла себя в руки, так как нужно было начинать другую жизнь без супруга, но с детьми, которых нужно ставить на ноги. Дети помогли восстановиться Ардакбубу. У Ардакбубу - средне-специальное образование, она закончила техникум, по специальности-повар. Поваром она проработала всего 5 лет. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Ардакбубу занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Ардакбубу и ее детей, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 15 овец, а также Ардакбубу вместе с детьми обрабатывает 2,40 ГА земли, где выращивает в основном фасоль и картофель. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. Ежемесячный доход составляет 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Ардакбубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Ардакбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Ardakbubu is 52 years old, widowed, and is raising four children on her own. Last year in August, Ardakbubu's husband died from a serious illness. Struggling to survive the death of her beloved husband, Ardakbubu braced herself, as it was necessary to start a new life without a spouse but with children who need to land on their feet. The children helped Ardakbubu to recover.

Ardakbubu has a specialized high school education. She graduated from a technical school, with a specialty as a cook. She worked as a cook for just five years.

As a main source of income for her family, Ardakbubu raises livestock, having started 20 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 10,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Ardakbubu and her children currently have on their homestead: one dairy cow, 15 sheep, and similarly Ardakbubu with her children works 2.40 hectares of land, where she grows mainly beans and potatoes. The resulting crop is sold to wholesale suppliers. Monthly income consists of 4,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Ardakbubu turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy cows for expanding her count of livestock.

Ardakbubu plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of domestic animals, and plans to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. Vilma is married and has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines.

Vilma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of fruit to sell.

Vilma has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Antonette

texts.en:
Antonette is a married woman, with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Antonette is 34 years old and has six children who are in school.

Antonette has a buy-and-sell recyclable materials business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more recyclable materials to sell.

Antonette has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy and sell scrap for her business.

loans.name: Jerusalem

texts.en:
Jerusalem is 35 years old and married, with four children, three of whom in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Jerusalem runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc.

Jerusalem has been in this business for 12 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc

loans.name: Oscar Arcides

texts.es:
Oscar de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta 2º grado, ya que sus padres no pudieron apoyarle mas para que siguiera con sus estudios. Esta casado, su esposa trabaja como ama de casa, tienen 4 hijos quienes estudian. 

Oscar desde que dejo la escuela, se dedico a trabajar en la agricultura junto a su padre, cultivo de  maíz y sorgo. Pero luego de un tiempo, Oscar tubo la oportunidad de iniciar con un nuevo empleo, como administrador de un cañal , así es como hasta el día de hoy, tiene aproximadamente 15 años de estar laborando en esta área. Ademas, a seguido trabajando en la agricultura, dichas actividades las realiza cerca de su casa donde vive, su horario son turnos de 8 horas continuas de trabajo de lunes a sábado y esta a 500 metros de su casa y viaja en su bicicleta.


El préstamo lo utilizara, para comprar semilla , abono , pesticidas para el cultivo de 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, de la que espera tener ingreso para su familia y estar mas tranquila y segura.


Oscar siempre ha querido tener un negocio propio y dedicarse a este, ademas sueña con darles estudio a sus cuatro hijos y se preparen profesionalmente, y no sufran las dificultades que él ha tenido que enfrentar.
texts.en:
Oscar is 40 years old and only has a second-grade education, since his parents were not able to support him further in his studies.  He is married, and his wife works as as a homemaker.  He has four children in school.

From the time he left school, he worked in agriculture alongside his father, growing corn and sorghum.  But after awhile, Oscar took the opportunity to start a new job as the administrator of a fish farm.  He has done this work for approximately 15 years.  He also works in agriculture for eight hours daily from Monday through Saturday.  He plants his crops in fields that are 500 meters from his home, and he travels there by bicycle.

He will use the loan proceeds in order to purchase seed corn, fertilizer and pesticide so that he can grow 14,000 square meters of corn.  This will allow him to provide income for his family and so that they can feel more comfortable and secure.

Oscar has always wanted to have his own business to which he can dedicate himself.  He also dreams of providing an education to his four children so that they can have professional careers and not have to suffer through the difficulties that he has had to face.

loans.use: to purchase seed corn, fertilizer and pesticide so that he can grow 14,000 square meters of corn.  This will enable him to provide income and greater security for his family.

loans.name: Sergio Miguel

texts.es: El señor Sergio tiene 25 años de edad, aún vive en la casa de sus padres en una zona  alejada de la ciudad de Cochabamba, es soltero y tiene un grado de instrucción de nivel bachillerato, no tiene  hijos dependientes, está estudiando la carrera de Técnico en Construcción ya que tiene muchas ganas de superarse e independizarse, tiene una amplia experiencia en el área de servicios de construcción, desde muy joven empezó a trabajar en el rubro, por esa razón es que tiene una antigüedad mayor a 10 años. Actualmente trabaja de lunes a sábado y por las noches estudia, pero como no tiene muchos recursos solicita un crédito para la compra de material de construcción para conclusión de una obra, de esta forma podrá obtener más ingresos para mejorar su nivel de vida y cubrir todos sus gastos.
texts.en:
Sergio is 25 years old.  He still lives in his parents’ home in a remote part of the city of Cochabamba.  He is single and doesn’t have any dependent children.  He completed school through high school and is studying to get his degree as a construction specialist because he really wants to improve himself and become more independent.  He has wide experience in the field of construction.  From a very young age he began to work in that field.  For this reason, he has more than ten years’ experience.

Currently he works from Mondays to Saturdays, and he studies at night. Since he doesn’t have a lot of financial resources, he is asking for a loan to buy the construction materials to finish a job.  In this way, he will be able to get more income to improve his quality of life and cover his expenses.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish a job.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair and gasoline for her business.

loans.name: Dibaldo Luis

texts.es:
Dibaldo vive en la ciudad de Ica y trabaja como chofer de taxi desde hace un año, con el fruto de su trabajo puede salir adelante, asimismo trabaja como vigilante  con lo cual tiene un dinero extra para los gastos  del hogar, mas aun porque es padre de 3 hijos.

Dibaldo esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general en su vehiculo y de esta manera oder seguir trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Dibaldo lives in the city of Ica.  He has worked as a taxi driver for a year.  With the fruit of his labor he can get by.  Additionally, he works as a security guard to earn extra money for his household expenses, because he is the father of three children.

Dibaldo is thankful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to take care of general maintenance on his vehicle.  In this way he can keep working and fighting to make his greatest dream come true: to have his own house.

loans.use: to pay for general maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil, imported oil, rice, and dry pepper for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soap and dishes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough fish to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock, including clothes, artificial hair, and cold water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед живет в столице Душанбе. Ему скоро исполнится 26 лет. У Хуршеда не большая семья. Он с женой живет вместе с мамой и братишкой Бахромом. Мама Хуршеда работает поваром в средней школе города Душанбе. Его жена домохозяйка. Хуршед работает водителем такси. У Хуршеда работа идет стабильно, и получает стабильную прибыль. Но к сожалению на данный момент машина Хуршеда нуждается в ремонте. Он просит кредит, чтобы отремонтировать свою машину купив необходимые запчасти. Часть кредита пойдет на ремонт дома. Он хочет сделать ремонт до появления ребенка. Хуршед женат, но детей у него пока что нет. Он хочет скорее стать отцом и доказать, что он будет хорошим и ответственным отцом.
texts.en:
Khurshed lives in the big city Dushanbe. He will soon be 26 years old. Khurshed does not have a big family. He and his wife live with his mother and little brother Bakhromom. Khurshed's mother works as a cook in a high school in Dushanbe. His wife is a homemaker.

Khurshed works as a taxi driver. Khurshed's work is stable, and he receives a stable income. But unfortunately at the moment Khurshed needs to do repairs. He is requesting a loan to repair his automobile, buying the necessary parts. Part of the loan will go to home repairs. He wants to do repairs before the arrival of a child.

Khurshed is married but not yet have children. He wants to become a father soon and to prove that he will be a good and responsible father.

loans.use: to repair his car and home

loans.name: Jhony Manuel

texts.es:
Jhony Manuel tiene 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, es una comunidad unida, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte el PERÚ.

El se dedica a la crianza de animales de corral patos, pollos, cuyes en su domicilio, con muchos años de experiencia en el negocio, son una familia unida, su esposa vende algarrobina a las juguerias de la zona, ocasionalmente Jhony ofrece servicios agrícolas a sus vecinos.

Jhony ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la comprar cerdos y pavos y una segunda parte para la compra de alimentos balanceados para tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jhony Manuel is 48 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Oyotún district.  This is a united community and its population are farmers, merchants, and raise livestock.  It’s located two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

He raises pen animals such as ducks, chickens, Guinea pigs, and has many years of experience in the business.  His wife sells carob syrup to the juicers in the area.  Sometimes Jhony offers agricultural services to his neighbors.

Jhony is asking for a loan of 1,500 New Soles to buy pigs and turkeys and balanced feed so that he can increase his production, offer more to his customers, and provide more income to his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs, turkeys, and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 51 years old.  She wishes to make her business grow and generate more profits by repairing her tricycle and purchasing groceries for her store. 

But Emelita finds an insufficiency of capital. This has caused her to request a loan of PHP 5,000 as maintenance for her tricycle and to buy groceries such as breads and beverages. 

This will surely help her to achieve economic stability and a pleasant quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain her tricycle and buy groceries and beverages for her store

loans.name: Bibian

texts.es: Bibian tiene 28 años, es soltera, estudia enfermería y para pagar sus estudios labora  en una farmacia de su localidad, beneficiaria  utilizará el crédito para solventar los gastos de estudios (compra de libros, uniforme, pago de matrícula, etc.) su meta es terminar sus estudios para mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Bibian, 28, is single.  She's studying nursing and she works in a pharmacy in her town to pay for her education.  She's going to use the loan to pay for her educational expenses (books, uniform, tuition, etc.).

Bibian's goal is to finish her studies to improve her quality of life and her family's.

loans.use: to pay for her education

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more snacks and biscuits for her business. 

She has had this business for more than five years now. Her loan is also helpful in the education of her children. Her income from business on the other hand is supporting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another PHP 35,000 loan to buy additional stocks of toys and other products needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. 

Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Candelaria dreams of having a supermarket someday and hopes to have a happy life. She attends the weekly fellowship* wherein she is inspired to share her weekly life experiences with her co-fellowship members, and she learns more about the importance of having quality time with God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy different snacks and biscuits needed in her business.

loans.name: Cherry Pie

texts.en:
Cherry Pie is 24 years old, married and has one child in school. 


She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional seedlings and fertilizers for her vegetables.


Cherry Pie has been farming vegetables for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.


In the future, Cherry Pie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional seedlings and fertilizers for her vegetables.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Anastacia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Anastacia is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Anastacia has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en:
Arlen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years now.

Arlen requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, Arlen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business retailing electronic loads for mobile phones in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase additional amounts of electronic mobile loads to sell for her retailing business.

Arlene has been in this business for 15 years. Arlene earns other income from food vending.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of electronic loads for mobile phones

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 33 years old, and a loving mother of a school-aged child. Mary lives with her family in the Bakan district, where she runs a business growing rice to sell. She has been doing this for more than 13 years, and earns approximately KHR10,000 per day.

Since Mary doesn't have a safe latrine for use at home, she is unable to help her family members improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. For this reason, she has requested a loan of KHR500,000 to build a household latrine. The water loan program offered by HKL, with a special interest rate has helped to encourage Mary to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family, and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his existing woolen and rubber carpet capacity

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto is 44 years of age and blessed with three children. He has been a farmer within his local community for twenty-two years. Through his experiences in farming, he is able to improve his farmland. The generated income from his farming has been used for their basic commodities and other household expenses. 


Now, he is in need of additional working capital for continuous growth of his rice field. With regards to this situation, he is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy rice seeds, pesticides and fertilizers.


He hopes he can obtain a plentiful harvest this next harvest season so he can generate greater income and save for the future of his family, especially for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, pesticides and fertilizer to use in his farming business.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
This is Mercedita. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mercedita dreams of being successful in business and hopes to help her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. That is also where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to sell

loans.name: Turdi

texts.ru: Турди живет в сельской местности. Ей 56 лет. Работает учительницей в школе. Муж работает в дехканском хозяйстве.У нее трое детей. Сыновья выросли и помогают семье. Но доход семьи недостаточен для развития семьи. Основным занятием жителей села является  скотоводство и земледелие. Для того чтобы повысить уровень жизни своей семьи Турди занимается разведением скота. В этом ей помогает дети и муж. Для развития своей деятельности она хочет взять кредит   для приобретения скота и кормов.  Турди обратилась в «Арванд» с этой целью, она уверена, что сможет развить свое дело и тем самым повысит благосостояние своей семьи.
texts.en: Turdi lives in a rural area.  She is 56 years old.  She works as a teacher at a school.  Her husband works at a dekhan farm.  She has three children.  Her sons have grown up and now help the family.  But the income in the family is not enough for continued family development.  Animal husbandry and farming are the primary types of activities for the village residents. In order to increase the quality of living for her family, Turdi is involved in breeding livestock.  Her children and husband help her with this.  She wants to request a loan to buy livestock and feed to grow her business.  Turdi came to Arvand with this goal and she is certain that she can grow her business and, thus, increase her family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy livestock and feed to grow her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the tuition fee for her daughter.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 54 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. Gloria works very hard to provide for them.
Gloria runs a buy-and-sell coffee business in The Philippines, and requested a PHP7000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of coffee to sell.
Gloria has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of coffee to sell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 48 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Elma works very hard to provide for them.

Elma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, chips, bread, etc.

Elma has been in this business for 20 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, chips, bread, etc

loans.name: Rosegelina

texts.en:
Rosegelina works hard to support her family. Rosegelina is married and has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

Rosegelina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Rosegelina has been in this business for 22 years.

In the future, Rosegelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Angelita works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetables and spices vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and a general store. Angelita is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more vegetables and spices to sell in her stall for her business.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices to sell in her stall

loans.name: Reynelda

texts.en:
Reynelda works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines.

Reynelda has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Reynelda has been in this business for 16 years now.

In the future, Reynelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Doña María Isabel es una señora con una edad de 34 años, luchadora, con muchos sueños, muchas esperanzas y anhelos de superarse y salir adelante. Ella es madre de 2 hijos quienes viven en casa y dependen de ella ya que estudian en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación. En compañía de sus esposo se dedica a la caficultura pero fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar desde muy pequeña y hoy en día sigue ejerciendo dicha actividad en compañía de sus esposo por más de 20 años ya que es la fuente de ingresos para su familia y hogar. Doña María Isabel Tiene un grado de educación primaria cursado hasta el 3 grado que por problemas económicos sus padres no pudieron apoyarla para que ella terminara la primaria. La tierra que en compañía de su esposo atiende es propia gracia a una herencia que fue dada por sus padres la cual está ubicada a 2 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan caminando en familia para que ella pudiese generar los ingresos para su hogar ya que no pudieron apoyarle en sus estudios para que ella fuese una persona preparada. Como desafíos encontrados en el trabajo de campo que ella realiza ha encontrado las plagas y los cambios climáticos por parte de la naturaleza ya que la competencia no es problema para poder vender su producto y generar ingresos. 
Sus sueños son poder obtener más tierra y más plantación de café ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad del producto ya que de esa forma ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y podrá tener una mayor estabilidad económica para re invertir en sus cultivos de café y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
Por lo que ella hoy en día solicita un financiamiento con el cual mejorara sus cultivos dando una mejor asistencia aplicando insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, formula cafetalera, fungicidas que evitaran la contaminación de bichos y enfermedades.
texts.en:
María Isabel, 34, is a determined woman with a lot of dreams, hopes, and desires for improving herself and getting ahead.  She's the mother of two children who live in her house and depend on her because they're in different grades in elementary school.

She and her husband make a living growing coffee.  It was her parents who taught her to work from a very young age, though, and today she has continued doing that job with her husband for more than 20 years because it's the source of income for her family and the household.  

María Isabel went to school up to third grade; her parents weren't able to support her in her studies because of financial problems so she didn't finish elementary school.  The land she and her husband farm is her own, thanks to an inheritance from her parents because they weren't able to support her in her studies so she could be trained.  The land's located two kilometers from her house; they walk there as a family so she can generate income for her household.  The challenges she has encountered in her farm work are pests and natural weather changes.  Competition isn't a problem for selling her crop and generating income.

María Isabel's dream is to acquire more land and more coffee farms to offer her customers a better variety of the crop.  This way she'll be able to improve her income and have greater economic stability to reinvest in her coffee crops and support her children in their studies.

This is why she's currently requesting a loan to improve and take care of her crops by applying agricultural inputs such as soil amendments, fertilizer, coffee formula, and fungicide to prevent contamination by pests and diseases.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crop

loans.name: Maria Camila

texts.es:
Ella es maria camila, actualmente estudia servicios farmacéuticos en campo alto, el servicio farmacéutico es muy interesante gracias a sus múltiples áreas de estudio y variedad de campos en lo que se puede desarrollar.
Decidí estudiar este técnico porque capo alto tiene muy buenas referencias gracias a su buena educación en todos los programas y por porque el servicio farmacéutico siempre a sido el área en el que le gustaría desempeñarse.
Le gustaría acceder al convenio con kiva para poder tener mas facilidad de pago para los estudios y poder culminar con este técnico que es una de las metas para llegar a ser la profesional dentro del área de farmacia.
