Con la ayuda de kiva puede terminar este proceso que ha sido muy gratificante y educativo y sera de gran ayuda en el futuro laboral cuando ya este graduada.
Podrá mejorar las opciones de trabajo y a si poder ayudar a la familia, quiere dar gracias akiva por darle la oportunidad a ella y a muchos estudiantes de campo alto de acceder a la ayuda económica que facilitara el buen desarrollo de el futuro académico.
texts.en:
Maria Camila currently studies Pharmaceutical Services in Campo Alto.  Pharmaceutical Services is very interesting, thanks to the many areas of study it includes and the variety of fields it offers, in which she can develop.

She decided to study this field because Campo Alto has a good reputation thanks to good education in all its programs, and because Pharmaceutical Services has always been the field she would like to be in.

She would like to enter into an arrangement with Kiva to be able to pay more easily for her studies so that she can finish her technical degree.  This is one of the steps to eventually become a professional in the field of pharmacy.

With the help of Kiva, she can finish this gratifying and educational process.  It will be a big help in her future work when she has graduated.  She will be able to improve her job options so she can help her family.  She wants to give thanks to Kiva for giving this opportunity to her and to many students at Campo Alto.  The financial help makes it easier to develop well in their academic future.

loans.use: to pay for one semester's registration

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 50 years old, married, and lives at Barangay 7, Polao, Tangub City, Philippines. To earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood.  The piglets' owners share in the profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30, depending in their agreement.  

With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well.
 
Through Pauglam MPC, she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets & feed. Now she requests a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy bags of feeds and piglets. 

She really hopes & prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to more easily keep sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy bags of feeds and piglets

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto Carlos tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de carnes rojas, viseras y cueros, en el interior del mercado de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de ganado vacuno y así incrementar su negocio, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Roberto Carlos is 44 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Oyotun district, where and its population are farmers, merchants, and raise livestock.  It’s located two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

He sells red meats, tripe, and skins at the local market.  He is asking for a loan of 3,000 New Soles to buy cattle so he can grow his business and earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en: Mareta is a 39-year-old single woman with 3 children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, cucumbers, green beans and tomatoes to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. Mareta has requested a loan to buy rakes, shovel, wheelbarrow, chemicals and seeds. She has been a member of SBPD for 2 years now. With her profits, Mareta hopes to improve her business so she can earn more money to support her family and her children.

loans.use: to buy rakes, shovel, wheelbarrow, chemicals and seeds

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is 23 years old, married and has one kid. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She earns a living by selling personal products in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like body lotion, perfume and other items.

Rona has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like body lotion, perfume and other items.

loans.name: Lanny

texts.en: Lanny is 53 years old, married, and works hard to help her husband. She has a pig-fattening business in The Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Lanny is borrowing PHP8000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs for her pig-fattening business. Lanny has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Vitsoben

texts.en:
Vitsoben is 42 years old, married and has one child who is in school. Vitsoben is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in The Philippines. Vitsoben requested a PHP6000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Vitsoben has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 39 years old and married with four children. Aida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in The Philippines, and requested a PHP10 000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, soap, and shampoo etc. to sell.

Aida has borrowed and paid back two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from food vending.

Aida aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, soap, and shampoo etc. to sell.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell shrimp business in the Philippines.

Aileen requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase shrimp to sell.

Aileen has been in this business for ten years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase shrimp to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 35 years old, married and works very hard to help her husband to earn a living.

Margarita runs a business buying and selling mahogany seeds in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of mahogany seeds to sell.

Margarita has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Margarita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase aadditional sacks of mahogany seeds to sell

loans.name: Lilyn

texts.en:
Lilyn is 40 years old and married with five children who are in school, Lilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Lilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell like soy sauce, milk, chips, eggs, etc.

Lilyn has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Lilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell like soy sauce, milk, chips, eggs, etc

loans.name: Blanca Evila

texts.es:
Blanca de 63 años de edad, estudio hasta  6º grado, ya que por problemas económicos de sus padres no pudo seguir estudiando, ella esta acompañada.

Blanca se dedica a la actividad agrícola, cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de maiz, cuida unas gallinas y una vaca que le da leche. Sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y están acompañados, ella solo convive con un nieto de 12 años, pero un hijo que vive cerca es el que le ayuda con las actividades que realiza .

Ella ha sido agricultora toda su vida, puesto que nació cerca de una hacienda donde se cultivaba mucho maíz , algodón y arroz y desde la edad de 10 años, inicio con la aventura en los campos agrícolas y los quehaceres de la casa junto a su padres, con  quien aprendió esta actividades. La cual de desarrolla en un terreno cerca de su casa Sin embargo, hay temporadas en la que la agricultura no es muy buena y los ingresos para mantener a su familia, se ven reducidos en gran manera y es así, que hace uno meses se a dedicado a la crianza de aves de corral y cuidar su vaca para que le produzca mas leche y a si vender mas queso.  


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abono e insecticidas, para el cultivo de 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, tambien comprara una maya para encerar sus aves de corral; pero lo que mas quiere es comprar otra vaca el cual espera tener buenas cosechas y mejores ingresos para su familia y no sufran como lo sufrió ella y darle una mejor educación a su nieto.

Los sueños y metas que quisiera conseguir y lograr Blanca son: primero tener salud para lograr los sueños de su nieto.
texts.en:
Blanca, 63, studied until the 6th grade. Due to her parents' lack of financial resources, she was unable to continue studying. She has a partner.

Blanca works in agriculture. She cultivates 7,000 square meters of corn and also raises chickens and a milk cow. Her children are older and are in relationships. She lives with her 12-year-old grandson. One of her sons who lives nearby helps her with her activities.

She has been a farmer for her entire life, having been born on a ranch where corn, cotton, and rice were grown. She started with farm labor and household chores when she was ten years old, learning from her parents. She grows her crops on a plot of land close to her house. There are some seasons in which the farm does not do very well and her income to maintain her family is much lower. Therefore, a few months ago, she started raising chickens and taking care of her milk cow so that it produces more milk and she can sell more cheese.

She has applied for a loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn. She will also buy a cage for her chickens. What she most wants, however, is to buy another cow. She hopes to have good harvests and better earnings for her family, so that they do not suffer what she suffered. She wants to give her grandson a better education.

Blanca's dream and goal is to have good health to make her grandson's dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn and to buy a cage for her chickens.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгул 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Супруг - фермер, дети учатся в школе. У Айгул - среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи Айгул занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 5 телят. На зиму Айгул со своей семьей уже заготовила 450 тюков сена, 1 тонну ячменя, 8 тонн кукурузы. Айгул ежедневно сдает 20 литров молока реализаторам за наличный расчет. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство дома для сына.
texts.en: Aigul is 40 years old, married and raising four children together with her husband. Her husband is a farmer, and children attend a school.  Aigul has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 18 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Aigul's hard work, today her business contains 3 dairy cows, 2 horses and 5 calves. Aigul and her family already prepared 450 haystacks, 1 ton of barley and 8 tons of corn.  Aigul sells 20 liters of milk daily to distributors.  The monthly income amounts to 12,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Aigul requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy cows to increase livestock headcount. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to build a house for her son.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Hurricane Sandy knocked down Tony’s car sales business, but he’s determined to rise again. He lost several vehicles totaling thousands of dollars. With light, flood and building damage, he could not conduct business for two months, costing him a significant amount of lost income.


However, following his most challenging year of business, Tony is looking to improve operations. He has opened a new, more secure location and now needs to get the word out with advertising. He will use this loan to initiate a marketing campaign in the Lakewood, New Jersey area.

loans.use: to advertise a new location for his car sales business hit hard by Hurricane Sandy.

loans.name: Sarafeen

texts.en:
Sarafeen is a 39-year-old woman, living with her five children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw which does not belong to him. With the help of savings, he has purchased a used auto rickshaw. Its engine quality is good, but the body is totally damaged. He does not have sufficient money to buy a new body and seat covers. He wants to start driving, but he is looking for a lump sum amount to buy a rickshaw body.

Therefore, Sarafeen requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy a new rickshaw body and can drive the rickshaw smoothly. 
Sarafeen hopes that her husband would be able to make more income because now he does not have any need to pay anyone for daily fares. 

Sarafeen is very happy after taking this loan. She gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body for her husband's business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 42 years old and married with two children.  With one child in school, Grace works very hard to provide for them. Grace runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like biscuits, noodles, canned goods, etc. to sell.  Grace has been in this business for 14 years.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like biscuits, noodles, canned goods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 42 years old and married, with three children, who are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Jean runs a business buying and selling school supplies and accessories in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional school supplies, like paper, ballpens, glue, etc., and other accessories, to sell.

Jean has been in this business for three years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional school supplies like paper, ballpens, glue, etc., and other accessories to sell

loans.name: Antonio José

texts.es:
Antonio a sus 53 años de edad, casado y con dos hijos, buscado salir adelante con su familia, tomó la decisión de continuar con el negocio de la ebanistería que le dejó como legado su padre al morir. Sus sueños son crecer, y generar empleo, metas que junto con su padre se había puesto, y también poder brindarle la posibilidad a sus dos jóvenes hijos de continuar capacitándose y educándose buscando asegurarles un mejor futuro.
En su negocio de la ebanistería es ampliamente conocido ya que lleva más de 30 años, sin embargo, hace poco sufrió un incidente en su negocio y se dañó uno de sus principales equipos. Necesita de nuestro apoyo para arreglar la máquina y volverla a poner en marcha y comprar algunos insumos necesarios (madera, puntillas, pegante, entre otros) para cubrir parte de la producción que necesita generar en las próximas semanas.
texts.en:
Antonio is 53 years old, married and has two children.  He has decided to continue his carpentry business that his father left him, in order to get ahead with his family.  His dreams are to grow his business, create jobs, and provide his children with the opportunity to continue their educations and secure a better future for them.  These are the goals that his father also left him.

His business is very well known, since he has been in business for more than 30 years, however he recently had an incident in his business, where one of his main machines was damaged.  He needs our help to have it fixed and also to buy some supplies (lumber, brads, glue, and other things) to cover production that he needs to complete in the next few weeks.

loans.use: to repair a machine and buy supplies.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina, a sus 20 años de edad y con todo un futuro por delante, busca a través de las ventas generar un ingreso que le permita continuar estudiando, y así terminar su carrera profesional en Administración de empresas en la Universidad de Antioquia. Va en el sexto semestre, y sabe que la lucha por los sueños no debe parar, a pesar de las dificultades que se presenten en el camino.

Aprovechando la temporada de navidad solicita el crédito para compra de mercancía como lociones, cremas de manos, entre otras cosas. Ella tiene el objetivo de poder generar los recursos que necesita para poderse matricular el próximo año, y continuar con su carrera, desde la cual se encuentra aprendiendo de finanzas, mercadeo, ventas, y otros temas, que sabe le van a servir muchísimo para poder crear una empresa en un futuro, que es su gran sueño.
texts.en:
Carolina, at 20 years of age and with her whole future ahead of her, is searching for a way to generate an income through sales that will enable her to continue studying and to finish her professional course work in Business Administration at the University of Antioquia. She is entering her sixth semester and knows that she cannot stop striving for her dreams despite difficulties along the way.

She is requesting a loan to take advantage of the Christmas season by buying merchandise such as lotions, hand creams and other items. Her objective is to generate the resources she needs to pay her tuition next year and continue her studies. She is learning about finance, markets, sales and other fields that she knows will be of great use in helping her to create a business in the future. This is her great dream.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as lotions, hand creams and other items.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en: Andrea is 65 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.  Andrea runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sugar, rice, coffee, canned goods, chips, eggs, etc. to sell.  Andrea has been in this business for 20 years.  In the future Andrea would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sugar, rice, coffee, canned goods, chips, eggs, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Bessie

texts.en:
As a married parent of one children, Bessie works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. 

Bessie is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stock (such as sugar, biscuits, and soap) to sell in her general store business. Bessie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock (such as sugar, biscuits, and soap) to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 54 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. Cristita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock (such as coffee, sugar, and milk) to sell.

Cristita has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.Cristita aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock (such as coffee, sugar, and milk) to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Group 1 - Tân Việt 01

texts.en:
Ms. Hang, 36, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of approximately 720,000 VND. She is married with two school-aged children. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1996. 

Her family is currently using a double-pit latrine, which is now degraded and has the risk of potential adverse affects to the health of her family members and her community, as well as environmental contamination. 

With a portion of this loan, she will be able to build a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. Those facilities would also help her family improve health, living conditions, afford safety for them, (particularly at night and during rainstorms). In addition the facilities will provide convenience, cleanliness and privacy for all family members, while contributing to the environmental protection of the community. 

In the picture, Ms. Hang is the first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new materials, such as specialty paper and stuffed animals, and special tools for working with wood and ceramics.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 50 years old and married.  She is a mother of two sons and three daughters.

She has been doing embroidery through machine at home for many years to support her family. In fact her husband is also doing the same work at home,  but he cannot earn sufficient income alone. So she helps her husband in his tasks related to the embroidery; she sells embroidery dresses in her town. 

By this time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She has become an expert in embroidery through machine.  Now she wants more raw materials so that she can easy cope with the increasing demand for her arts. 

Samina thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.  She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras - Chilca Group

texts.es:
Jessica  tiene 26 años , conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 5 años, al terminar sus estudios secundarios, se puso a trabajar para ayudar a sus padres.
 
Ella se dedica a los tejidos en lana sobre todo pantis, gorros y chompas para niños y niñas los hace de diversos colores de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes (tiendas), a ella le enseñó a tejer su hermana mayor que desde mucho más antes se dedica a este negocio.

Jessica ya trabaja 1 años con Edaprospo  el dinero que obtuvo es para la compra de lana hilos, botones, cierres, para elaborar sus tejidos, ya que se acercan las fiestas navideñas y tiene muchos pedidos 

En el futuro le gustaría comprar más maquinas de tejer y dar empleo a otras personas que necesitan trabajar.
Jessica esta agradecida por confiar en ella en otorgarle dinero que lo invertirá en su negocio y le generará más ingresos para su hogar.

Jessica esta vestida con chompa de color verde y es la primera de la derecha.
texts.en:
Jessica is 26 years old. She lives with her partner and has two children, aged 3 and 5. After finishing her secondary education, she started working to help her parents. 

She principally works with wool fabrics to make clothing, particularly stockings, caps and sweaters for both girls and boys. She makes these in a variety of colors, depending on the customer's order. She learned to sew and weave from her older sister, who had been in this same line of work for a long time.

Jessica is in her first year with Edaprospo. The money from this loan is for buying wool, thread, buttons, and clasps so that she can make her clothing. Christmas was coming up and there are many orders to fill at that time of year.

In the future, she would like to have more sewing machines so that she can hire other people who need work. Jessica is grateful for the trust shown in her and for the provided money that she will invest in her business and use to increase her income to support her household.

Jessica is the one in the green sweater, first on the right.

loans.use: buy wool, thread, buttons and other clothing needs.

loans.name: Muheza Group

texts.en:
Maguno, who is in her early 30's, is single with one child who is still at school. She has been selling ladies' new clothes and shoes door to door for three years now.  She works from 8 AM to 6 PM daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Maguno's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to keep on buying clothes and shoes to resell and has successfully paid back the loans.  She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy new ladies' clothes and shoes. She dreams of opening a shop for selling her products.

Maguno will share this loan with her loan group Muheza with three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new  ladies' clothes and  shoes.

loans.name: San Martin  - Izcuchaca Group

texts.es:
CLARA ES UNA MUJER EMPRENDEDORA QUE TIENE 39 AÑOS DE EDAD,SOLTERA Y A SU CARGO TIENE 02 HIJOS EN ETAPA ESCOLAR.
ELLA TRABAJA VENDIENDO PANES ESPECIALES EN LA PLAZA DE SU LOCALIDAD, LOS INGRESOS QUE OBTIENE DE ESAS VENTAS, LO UTILIZA PARA SUS GASTOS DEL HOGAR; Y SOBRE TODO PARA LA EDUCACIÓN DE SUS 02 MENORES HIJOS.
CLARA EMPEZÓ CON ESTE NEGOCIO DESDE MUY NIÑA,POR QUE AYUDABA A SUS PADRES.
ELLA EMPIEZA A VENDER SUS PANES DESDE LAS 4:00 A.M HASTA LAS 5 DE LA TARDE, DE MANERA DIARIA.
SU MAS GRANDE SUEÑO ES EL DE TENER UNA PANADERÍA Y QUE SUS HIJOS SEAN PROFESIONALES, YA QUE ELLA SOLO PUDO ESTUDIAR LA PRIMARIA.
ELLA SE ENCUENTRA MUY CONTENTA Y AGRADECIDA POR EL APOYO QUE SE LE BRINDA AL OTORGARLE DINERO PARA INVERTIRLO EN SU NEGOCIO.
EN LA FOTOGRAFÍA SE PUEDE VER A CLARA CON UN POLO DE COLOR NEGRO, ES LA PRIMERA DE LA IZQUIERDA.
texts.en:
Clara is an enterprising woman, age 39, single, and has two school-aged children.
She spells special bread in the local plaza and uses her income to cover the household costs and, above all, for the education of her two young children.
Clara started this business at a very young age, because she helped her parents.
She starts selling her breads at 4:00 am and works until 5:00 pm, every day.
Her greatest dream is to have a bakery and for her children to be professionals; she was only able to attend primary school.
She is very happy and grateful for the help of having this loan to invest in her business.
In the photo, Clara is the first on the left, wearing a black polo.

loans.use: to buy flour, bags, etc.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras - Tinyari Group

texts.es:
DELMA ES UNA MUJER DE 47 AÑOS, LLEVA 06 MESES TRABAJANDO CON EDAPROSPO, ES SOLTERA.

ELLA SIEMPRE SE HA DEDICADO A LA AGRICULTURA Y GANADERÍA , POR QUE ESO LE ENSEÑO SUS PADRES, ELLA ADEMÁS VENDE LA LECHE QUE PRODUCE SU GANADO.
A DELMA LE HA AYUDADO MUCHO SUS ACTIVIDAD, YA QUE ES UNA MANERA DE APORTAR A LA COMUNIDAD QUE ELLA PERTENECE, DONDE TODOS SE DEDICAN A LA AGRICULTURA Y GANADERÍA, ELLA TRABAJA PARA APOYAR A SUS SOBRINOS.

EN EL FUTURO LE GUSTARÍA TENER MAS CABEZAS DE GANADO Y CONVERTIRSE EN UNA MICROEMPRESARIA.

ELLA LE GUSTA TRABAJAR EN GRUPO, POR QUE ES MUY AMIGABLE Y POR QUE SE APOYAN PARA HACER CRECER SUS NEGOCIOS.
DELMA SOLO TIENE PALABRAS DE AGRADECIMIENTO POR EL APOYO OBTENIDO, POR QUE ASI CUMPLIRA SU SUEÑO DE VIAJAR FUERA DEL PERÚ Y CONOCER OTROS PAISES.

EN LA FOTOGRAFÍA VISTE UNA CHOMPA CELESTE CON POLO VERDE, ES LA SEGUNDA PERSONA DE LA IZQUIERDA, EN LA SEGUNDA FILA, ( EL SEÑOR QUE SE VE EN LA FOTO ES EL ESPOSO DE UNA DE LAS SOCIAS)
texts.en:
Delma is a 47 year-old woman.  She has worked with Edaprospo for six months.  She is single.

She has always worked farming and raising cattle, because her parents taught her this.  She also sells the milk that her herd produces.  Her various jobs have helped Delma a lot, because they are a way to contribute to the community that she belongs to, where everyone works in farming and raising cattle.  She works to support her nephews.

In the future, she would like to have more head of cattle and become a microenterprise.

She likes to do group work, because she is very friendly and because they support each other as they grow their businesses.

Delma only has words of thanks for the support she has received, because in this way she will fulfill her dream of traveling out of Perú and getting to know other countries.

In the photo, she is wearing a blue sweater with a green shirt.  She is the second person from the left in the second row.  The man that is seen in the photo is the husband of one of the members.

loans.use: to buy special feed for cattle.

loans.name: Paz Y Progreso Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Paz Y Progreso” conformada por 12 mujeres emprendedoras y responsables que buscan mejorar cada día. Guadalupe  de 62 años es separada con 02 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de desayuno en un paradero recurrente. Gracias a su trabajo Guadalupe ha podido  sacar adelante a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda.  Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de panes,  avena, vasos, jarras y así poderles brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Seguir trabajando positivamente es su mayor deseo. El grupo “Paz Y Progreso” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Guadalupe se encuentra de pie,  es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste blusa color lila. En la parte superior a lado izquierdo se encuentra fani  la cual no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en: This is the “Paz and Progreso” group, made up of 12 responsible entrepreneurial women who seek to improve every day.  Guadalupe is 62 years old, separated and has two adult children.  She sells breakfast from a fixed location and thanks to her work, Guadalupe has managed to get her children ahead and improve her home.  She used her previous loan to buy breads, oatmeal, glasses, and pitchers so she could provide better customer service.  Her greatest desire is to continue working and the “Paz y Progreso” group is grateful to those who made this loan possible.  Guadalupe is standing and is the second from the left, wearing a lilac colored blouse.  Fani’s picture is attached in the upper left; she was late because of her work.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: El Progreso De La Amistad Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “El Progreso De La Amistad” está conformada por 06 socios dedicados a distintas actividades de comercio. Este es el caso de Sandra de 41 años casada con 03 hijos 02 de ellos aún dependientes. La Sra.: Sandra es una madre empeñosa que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Actualmente se dedica  a la venta de prendas de vestir, la cual lo realiza a pedidos. Se siente feliz pues cada vez mejora su economía. En esta oportunidad solicitó el crédito para la compra de polos, faldas, chores, blusas y así poder ofrecer a sus clientes. El anhelo de Sandra es de seguir mejorando su negocio. El grupo “El Progreso De La Amistad” agradece a Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Sandra se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste casaca ploma, en brazos lleva a su menor hija. En la parte superior al lado izquierdo se encuentra Cesar la cual no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en: The "El Progreso de la Amistad" communal bank has six members who have different businesses each.  Sandra is 41 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is now independent.  Sandra is a determined mother who, with a lot of effort and dedication, has managed to support her husband with household costs.  She currently makes a living selling clothes on order. Sandra is happy as her financial situation is improving.  On this occasion Sandra is applying for a loan in order to buy t-shirts, shorts and blouses to offer to her customers.  Sandra's wish is to continue improving her business.  The "El Progreso de la Amistad" group is grateful to Kiva for the support provided. In the photo, Sandra is the first on the left, sitting down, wearing a grey sweatshirt.  She is holding her young daughter in her arms.  The photo in the top left is of Cesar, who could not come to the meeting on time due to work commitments.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, skirts, shorts and blouses.

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es: La Sra. Gabriela cliente antigua de la institución sigue con la misma actividad del tejido de mantas y  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de lana por mayor,   en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de juguetes ya que esta es su segunda actividad solo por fin de año ella vende en distintas ferias d la ciudad de La Paz, la Sra. Gabriela se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio
texts.en: Gabriela is a previous client of this institution and she is continuing with the same business of knitting blankets.  She says that she used the money from the previous loan to buy yarn in quantity and she is asking for a new loan to buy toys, because this is her secondary business, but only at years end.  She sells at various fairs in La Paz.  Gabriela is happy and grateful for the opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy toys.

loans.name: Marisa Yanira

texts.es:
Marisa, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo crédito para invertir en la compra de camisas, blusas, pantalones y faldas, le ayudara a tener su inventario muy surtido para esta temporada navideña y tener ingresos extras.
El crédito anterior le permitió fortalecer su negocio, mejorar su economía, cancelo sus deudas y ha mejorado su el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Marisa finds herself needing to ask for a new loan to invest in the purchase of shirts, blouses, pants, and skirts.  It will help her to have a well-stocked inventory for this Christmas season, and to have extra income.

The previous loan allowed her to strengthen her business, improve her finances, and cancel her debts. It has improved her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, pants, and skirts.

loans.name: Arely

texts.es:
Arely, necesita comprar maíz, leña, gas propano y dará mantenimiento a la plancha industrial, con lo podrá seguir trabajando y dando una buena  atención a sus clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior pudo aumentar su producción, con lo que atrajo nuevos clientes, aumento las ventas, mejoro su economía con lo que ha podido cancelar su crédito y sus condiciones familiares son mejores pues ha podido comprar electrodomésticos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Arely needs to buy corn, firewood, and propane gas, and to do maintenance on her industrial griddle.  With all of this, she will be able to keep working and give good service to her customers.

With her previous loan, she managed to increase her production, and thus attract new customers, increase her sales, and improve her finances.  She was able to pay off her debt and improve her family’s living conditions by buying electric appliances for her home.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and propane gas, and to give maintenance to her industrial griddle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a clean cooking package so he can prepare healthier meals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a complete cooking gas set

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cooking gas package

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa is married, with three children. She runs a retail store in their village, while her husband farms to make a living. After six years in her business, Analisa earns good enough for their basic needs. She always finds ways to augment their living. 

She was thankful after joining GDMPC, and requests a loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. 

She is hopeful to have a better income from her investments and efforts towards improving the business. 

She wants to have better life with her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 48 years old and married with three children who are in school. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc.. to sell.

She has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc.. to sell

loans.name: Avelin

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Avelin works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling Avon and personal collection products. 

Avelin is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Avelin has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet works hard to support her family; she is married, and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Juliet has been in this business for five years.

Juliet requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, milk, cooking, etc..

In the future, Juliet would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, milk, cooking, etc.

loans.name: Viviana Victoria

texts.es:
Viviana, tiene 39 años de edad, vive en la calurosa ciudad de Pucallpa, junto a sus 04 hijos, Viviana es una persona muy alegre y carismática ella trabaja en el área de ventas de una empresa de su ciudad, trabajo el cual lo realiza con muchas responsabilidad y así lograr ser la mejor vendedora de todos los meses.
Viviana está  muy agradecida con los prestatarios de KIVA, ya que el dinero lo invertirá para arreglar su vivienda (compra de madera, clavo, etc.)
El sueño de Viviana es lograr construir su casa de material noble y así darles una buena calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Viviana is 39 years old and lives in the welcoming city of Pucallpa with her four children. Viviana is a very happy and charismatic person. She works in sales for a business in her city, work that she performs so responsibly that she is the best salesperson every month.

Viviana is very grateful to KIVA lenders and will invest the money to refurbish her dwelling (purchasing wood, nails, etc.)

Viviana’s dream is to construct her house of fine material and thus provide a good quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction material

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane helps her husband on their farm while at the same time, she manages her piggery to make a living. For five years selling pigs in town, Mary Jane has earned well for the family and has been able to support the education of her five children. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase feed to boost her pigs. She is hopeful to earn more profit to save more for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rodrigo works hard to support his family. He has a buy and sell spice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a buy and sell rice business. 

Rodrigo is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spices to sell for his buy and sell spice business.

Rodrigo has been sustaining his business activities through his past 13 loans from NWTF. 

He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream to save enough money so he could afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices to sell

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is the age of 37; she is living with her three children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been selling fruit for many years; he sells seasonal fresh fruit in his hometown. He uses a four wheeled manual cart for selling; as a hawker, he can easily reach people. The people like to buy fruit at their door, instead of coming to the market. Due to fruit’s freshness, he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Due to his reputation, the demand for fruit has increased and at noon, his stock comes to an end.

Farzana is proud of her husband, and appreciates his efforts for his family. 

Farzana is taking loan for her husband so he can buy fruit in greater quantities.

Farzana wants to save the excess profit so that she could use these saving for future sudden needs, and for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy fruits to sell from a cart.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is married with four children. Nelia is 44 years old, and three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nelia has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

Nelia requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

She has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Rudesa

texts.en:
Rudesa is 33 years old and married with two children, who are in school. Rudesa works very hard to provide for them.

Rudesa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, canned goods, chips, biscuits, soap, etc. to sell. Rudesa has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, canned goods, chips, biscuits, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Bernalyn

texts.en:
Bernalyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Bernalyn has been in this business for 10 years now.

Bernalyn requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy another bicycle unit for her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy another bicycle unit for her business

loans.name: Argentina

texts.es: Argentina, tiene 29 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene dos hijos  y vive en el  municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. Ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva café desde hace 4 años, el cual es vendido en la zona y obtiene sus propios ingresos. Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo que es por 20,000 lempiras, con el cual va poder sembrar café en 2 manzanas de terreno, así podrá recuperar las plantas que perdió por la plaga. Su plan es seguir trabajando para mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Argentina is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the town of Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. 
She has land where she has grown coffee for 4 years. The coffee is sold in the area and provides her her own income. 
She has applied for a second loan is of 20,000 lempiras, with which she will be able to plant coffee on 2 acres of land, and be able to recover the plants she lost in the plague. 

Her plan is to continue working to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to grow coffee on 2 acres of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package to help her cook faster

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a gas cooking package and save money normally spent on charcoal

loans.name: Alpha

texts.fr: ALPHA est un homme âgé de 36 ans, marié et père de 03enfants. Il évolue dans le transport de taxi et a une expérience de plus de 5ans. ALPHA commence sa journée à 9h pour revenir à la maison vers les environs de 19h. Il est à son 3ème  prêt et sollicite celui-ci pour réparer son véhicule qui est en panne. Elle prend en charges les dépenses quotidiennes de sa femme et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. A l’avenir il voudrait acheter un bus pour faire de longues distances et pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et épargner un peu d’argent.
texts.en:
Alpha is a 36-year-old man, married with three children. He operates in the business of transportation by taxi and has five years of experience.  Alpha starts his day at 9 am to return home around 7 pm.  

This is his third loan and he is requesting it to repair his vehicle that broke down. He provides for his wife’s daily expenses and for the children’s school fees. 

In the future he would like to buy a bus to cover long distances and to be able to increase his income, improve his family’s living conditions and save a little money.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn works hard to support her family. Roselyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc. to sell.  Roselyn has been in this business for five years now.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Esmeralda

texts.es:
Rosa de 36 años de edad, tubo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta sexto grado, gracias a la ayuda que le dieron sus padres, desgraciadamente su padre falleció y no pudo continuar con los estudios, ahora tiene 2 hijos, ellos asisten a la escuela y es madre soltera, ya que su esposo la abandono y ella sola quien criá a sus hijos.

Desde que abandono la escuela, Rosa ayudaba a su madre, en los trabajos de agricultura. Ahora siembra 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, con ayuda de su hermana. Ademas, tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace un año y medio, la cual le a mejorado los ingresos y a la vez, ha minimizado el riesgo de que pueda quedarse sin ingresos, por solo depender de la siembra de maíz, ya que muchas veces la perdidas son cuantiosas, y la producción se ve gravemente afectada. El lugar donde ella cultiva, esta a dos kilómetros y medio de su casa y ese recorrido lo hace en bicicleta, trabajando desde las seis de la mañana, hasta las dos de la tarde. El trabajo lo realiza con su hermana y contratan los servicios de otra persona que les ayuda a realizar las labores mas pesadas que ellas no pueden hacer.


El préstamo sera invertido, en la ampliación de la tienda, donde comprara mas productos para la venta y lograra hacer un cafetin mas amplio, donde tener la mercedaria. Con el préstamo, se estará ayudando a que continué con la tienda y que no dependan sus ingresos solo de la agricultura y asegurar el alimento para sus hijos.


Le gustaría tener una tienda mas amplia, donde poder vender una gran variedad de productos, ademas le gustaría tener su propia casa.  Para sus hijos, desea todo lo mejor, por lo cual esta dispuesta a ayudarles para que estudien y se logren preparar academicamente.
texts.en:
Rosa, 36, had the opportunity to study up to sixth grade thanks to the help of her parents.  Unfortunately her father died and she couldn't continue attending school.  Now she has two children.  They go to school and she's a single mother who she raises her children alone because her husband abandoned her.

Rosa helped her mother with the agricultural labor after she stopped going to school.  Now she plants 14,000 square meters of corn with the help of her sister.  She also has had a small store for the last year and a half, which has improved her income and minimized the risk of being left without an income.  Depending solely on the corn, often the losses are numerous and the crop is seriously affected.

The land she farms is 2.5 kilometers from her house and she gets there on bicycle, working from 6 in the morning until 2 in the afternoon.  Her sister helps her with the work and they hire the services of another person to help with the heaviest work that they can't do.

She'll invest the loan in expanding the store where she has the merchandise, buying more products to sell, and having a larger café.  With the loan she'll be helping continue the store so her income doesn't depend solely on agriculture, and she'll be assuring that her children have food.

Rosa would like to have a bigger store where she could sell a variety of products.  She would also like to have her own house.  She wants all the best for her children and is willing to help them study and be academically prepared.

loans.use: to buy products and to expand her store

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio has been working as a farmer for over 55 years growing and selling tomatoes.  His wife Angela used to help him with the business but Antonio's mother, Rita, got very sick and moved in with them.  Now Angela takes care of her and the house.  Although every year physical labor gets harder, Antonio continues working each day from sunrise to sundown.  Antonio and Angela also live with their son Osvaldo who commutes every day to a neighboring town for work.  Rita and Osvaldo are thankful for the sacrifices Antonio makes every day to give them a home and a shelter. 

The family is excited to be together but has been living in a house that has only one complete bedroom and another bedroom with a tin roof and improvised walls.  Antonio has been saving for the last three months to finish building Osvaldo's room, and to build an additional room for his mom.  Since all family members work at home or on the field, and have no proof of income, they do not have access to credit from banks or other organizations.  As such, Antonio is now asking for this Kiva loan to complete the payment of materials needed, and the family will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction.  The new rooms will give Antonio and Angela their own space, a proper space to Osvaldo, and a private bedroom to Rita.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a room for his mother and his son

loans.name: Bartolisa

texts.en: Bartolisa is 51 years old and has a live-in partner. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Bartolisa has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers.  She has been in this business for six years.  In the future, Bartolisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Emigdio

texts.en:
Emigdio and his wife Agustina have lived in Totolapan, Morelos all their lives.  Emigdio used to work as a farmer but left that job to his children and now makes a living as a self-employed construction worker.  Agustina works in a nearby convenience store helping with anything that is needed.  

The house they live in is the result of years of work.  The tin roof makes the house really humid in spring and summer and very cold in winter, and with their age these changes are harder each year.  Emigdio wants to change the roof for a more adequate one and build a proper bathroom in the house so there is no need to walk outside every time they want to use it.  Emigdio and Agustina have been saving for the last three months to replace the roof with a proper cement roof and to build the bathroom. 

Together, the couple makes around $800 USD a month.  Because they have informal jobs, they do not have access to credit from other organizations.  Emigdio is requesting this loan to finish paying for the materials he needs for the home improvements.  These improvements are a way for Emigdio and Agustina to have a better chance at improving their quality of lives, and they will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction.

loans.use: to pay for materials needed to build a proper roof and a bathroom

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a single mother of two beautiful kids.  She works as a maid in a nearby residential complex.  It is hard for her to be away from her kids, but she knows hard work is the best way to give them what they need.

When her youngest son was born she dreamed of giving them a bigger house.  She started doing some renovations but soon realized she needed help.  Martha has been saving for the last three months to be able to buy the materials she needs to complete her house.  She is now asking for a loan to finish the payment.  Given that Martha's job is not a formal one, and she earns around $600 USD a month, she cannot access credit from traditional institutions.  Martha will receive technical assistance and supervision from certified workers to make sure that the construction complies with all safety and quality standards. 

Martha has been working hard and saving to give her two kids the house she dreamed of.  She is looking forward to completing this dream and seeing her kids grow in a safe and healthy environment.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish building her house

loans.name: Douglas Eliseo

texts.es: Douglas de 47años de edad vive junto a su familia en casa propia, el posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, pan, leche, huevos, jabones, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, es muy conocido en la zona donde el reside y ya tiene clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios, y el excelente servicio; desea acrecentar el negocio pero no posee del suficiente capital para lograrlo por eso le solicita a INETEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, producto instantáneo, bebidas, jabones, etc. el cliente tiene buenas referencias de pago es responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a al mismo tiempo tiene fe que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica
texts.en: Douglas is 47 years old and lives with his family in a house of his own.  He has a store where he sells primary needs products such as beans, bread, milk, eggs, soaps, and other things.  He has had this business for several years and this has provided him with lots of sales experience and he makes a good income.  He is very well known in his area and he has customers who prefer to buy from him because of the quality and good prices and quality of his products.  He wants to grow his business but doesn’t have enough capital, so he is asking for a loan through INTEGRAL to buy basic grains, snacks, bread, instant products, beverages, soaps, etc.  He has good credit references and is responsible.  He is certain that he can get out of debt and he has faith that he will be able to provide financial security to his home.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Griselda Isabel

texts.es: Griselda de 39 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida.  Ella posee una tortillería la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde  reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vende las mejores tortillas, adicional a eso se dedica  ala evnta de atoles como de elote, de maiz, de maicena, etc. griselda es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, por esa razon esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar los ingredientes necesarios para preparar los atoles como maiz, elotes, leche, maicenas, etc. todo por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio que igual que la venta de tortillas le genera buenas ganancias . Griselda  tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en:
Griselda is 39 years old and lives with her life companion. She has a tortilla shop which is well-known in her area. She has many clients as she makes the best tortillas. Besides this she sells atole (traditional drink) from corn on the cob, corn, cornflour etc.

Griselda is an enterprising woman with the desire to get ahead. This is why she has requested a loan from INTEGRAL. This will allow her to buy the ingredients necessary to prepare her atoles like, corn, corn-on-the cob, cornflour, etc. wholesale. Then she can continue with her business which, like her tortillas, generates good money. Griselda hopes that by doing this she can bring some economic security and a full life for her family

loans.use: to buy corn, elote (corn on the cob), milk, corn flour, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Las Violetas Group

texts.es: Teresa de 48 años es soltera y tiene 03 hijos 02 de ellos en etapa escolar, actualmente es socia del grupo “Las Violetas” conformada por 06 socios trabajadores que han ido mejorando a través de sus negocios. Con los deseos de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Teresa decide emprender su propio negocio, donde actualmente ofrece golosinas en un parque de su localidad. Se siente feliz pues con su perseverancia ha podido cumplir con algunos de sus objetivos. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de bebidas y golosinas. Su siguiente meta es  de poner un puesto donde pueda ofrecer sus productos. El grupo “Las Violetas” agradece el apoyo brindado y se compromete a seguir trabajando bien.  Teresa es la tercera del lado izquierdo, viste polo blanco y pantalón rojo.
texts.en:
Teresa is 48 years old. She is single and has three children two of which are in school. She is a member of the “Las Violetas” communal bank which is made up of six people who have improved their lives through their businesses.

With the desire to offer her family a better quality of living, Teresa decided to start her own business which is selling sweets in a local park. She is happy that she has been able to fulfill some of her objectives. Her last loan went to buying sweets and drinks. Her next goal is to get a stand from which to sell her goods.

The “Las Violetas” communal bank is grateful for the support offered and promise to continue to work hard. Teresa is the third from the left, wearing a white shirt and red pants

loans.use: to buy drinks and sweets.

loans.name: Hilda Guadalupe

texts.es: Hilda de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos, ella posee un negocio de venta de productos como: piñatas, productos de belleza, juguetes, productos para el cabello, etc. desde hace varios años, posee mucha clientela pues esta en lugar muy estratégico donde pasan muchas personas, por esa razón posee mucha clientela, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Hilda esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder segur con su negocio que le genera buenas ganancias  y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
37-year old Hilda lives in her own house with her husband and three children. She has run a business selling such items as piñatas, beauty products, toys, hair products etc. for several years. Hilda has many customers as her store is in a good location: many people pass by. With the money she earns, Hilda pays for household expenses. 

She is now seeking a loan to buy more products at wholesale prices so she can continue with her business and earn a good income. In this way she will be able to provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: Buy piñatas, beauty products, toys, hair products etc at wholesale prices

loans.name: Johanna Isabel

texts.es: La señora Johana tiene 43 años de edad, es soltera estudiante de la  carrera de ingeniería civil, ella se dedica a la venta de lubricantes para  vehículos, con este negocio cubre sus gastos del hogar y de la familia. Ella solicita el apoyo de crédito para poder ingresar al seminario de graduación y tramitar su título profesional, a futuro desea estudiar una maestría  en derecho penal, tiene muchos ánimos de superación y espera que con su titulo pueda hacer sus sueños realidad.
texts.en: Johana is 43 years old, single, and is a civil engineering student.  She sells automotive lubricants and this business covers her household and family expenses.  She is asking for this loan so she can graduate and obtain her professional title.  In the future she wants study for a master’s degree in criminal justice.  She has many desires to get ahead and hopes that she can make her dreams come true with her title.

loans.use: to pay for her degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cooking gas package that will help her cook faster

loans.name: Berna Luz

texts.es: La señora Berna, es casada junto a su esposo se dedica al negocio de la ferretería en un mercado de Managua, lucha a diario para sacar a delante a su hija quien es estudiante universitaria, para ella es muy importante la preparación de su hija, para que en un futuro se pueda valer por sí misma. Berna tiene muchos ánimos darle  un poco de vida a su hogar pasándole una mano de pintura y así de paso proteger las verjas, las cuales con el pasar del tiempo obtienen sarro deteriorándose por completo, solicita el crédito con el que comprara pintura de aceite y diluyente.
texts.en:
Berna is married.  Together, she and her husband have a hardware business at the Managua market.  She struggles every day in order to get her daughter ahead.  Her daughter is a university student.  Her daughter’s preparation is very important to her so that in the future she is able to make it on her own.

Berna is very motivated to give her home a little bit of life with a fresh coat of paint.  This way she will protect the fences, which with the passage of time have rusted and completely deteriorated.  She is requesting the loan to buy oil paint and thinner.

loans.use: to buy oil paint and thinner.

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
This is Filipina. She previously accessed a 21,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stocks of dried fish, biscuits and frozen foods needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to purchase additional stocks of dried fish, biscuits and frozen foods needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness from her heart.

Filipina hopes to continuously expand her business and dreams to have a better life. Every week she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of dried fish, biscuits and frozen foods needed in her business

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr:
La dame Coumba a ouvert une petite table devant chez elle, où elle vend des denrées alimentaires comme du lait, du sucre, du riz. Elle a démarré avec un capital de 100.000F CFA tiré d’une tontine acquise à cette période. C’est elle qui vend dans sa boutique et n’est remplacé que très rarement par une de ses filles.  Elle est mariée et mère de famille et participe activement à la gestion de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille en appui à son mari. 
Coumba est une femme ambitieuse qui pense à améliorer son activité en élargissant son espace commercial et à diversifier cette dernière. Elle compte réaliser ce projet avec l’aide d’une mutuelle comme l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
Lady Coumba started a small stall in front of her home, where she sells food such as milk, sugar, and rice. She started with a capital of 100,000 francs CFA obtained from a savings group (tontine) she received at that time. She is the one who sells in her shop and is only rarely replaced by one of her daughters. 

She is married and a mother. She actively participates in the management of the family’s daily expenses to support her husband.
Coumba is an ambitious woman who thinks to improve her business by expanding her retail space and diversifying it. She expects to accomplish this project with the help of an institution such as IMCEC.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff; milk, rice and sugar to stock her shop and retail.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 44 years old and married with five children.

Ruby works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, soap, cream, coffee, sugar, etc.

Ruby has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Ruby aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, soap, cream, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell peanut business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 33 years. Eufemia also earns more income from a general store.

She is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of peanut to sell for her buy-and-sell peanut business. Eufemia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Gladis Ester

texts.es:
Gladis de 57 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos, ya todos están casados, ella solo vive con 2 nietos que cuida porque los hijos están en los estados unidos.
Ella no posee ningún grado de estudio, solo sabe poner sus iniciales; porque sus padres no se preocupaban por que ellos estudiaran. Es de mencionar también que proviene de una familia de 11 hermanos de los cuales 6 murieron en tiempos de guerra, y ella era de las mayores y tenía que ayudar en los oficios de la casa.
Ella todo su vida se ha dedicado a comprar y vender ganado en cantidades menores con un hermano, pero hace algunos años murió su hermano y ya no sintió el mismo respaldo, hoy en día tiene una tienda en su casa de productos básicos y es de ahí donde ella sobrevive.
Con el préstamo que esta solicitando, es para surtir su tienda y comprar cohetes para la venta en navidad, además con los créditos anteriores ha podido comprar 2 vacas ya con estos ingresos adicionales ella mejorara su condición de vida.
Su deseo es seguir trabajando con los impulsos de los créditos,  ampliar su tienda, tener una mejor condición de vida y sobre todo poder visitar a los hijos que tiene en los estados unidos.
texts.en:
57-year old Gladis has six children, all married. She is raising two of her grandchildren as their parents are in the United States. Gladis did not attend school; she can only write her initials. Her parents didn't consider education to be important. She comes from a family of eleven children, six of whom died in the war. She was one of the eldest and had to help in the house.

For the whole of her life Gladis and a brother bought and sold a small number of cattle. However, her brother died some years ago and she didn't have the same support, so nowadays she runs a small store from her house selling basic supplies. This is how she survives.

With the loan she is seeking Gladis plans to buy stock for her store including fireworks for Christmas. With previous loans she was able to buy two cows and her standard of living has already improved.

Gladis wishes to keep working, and with profits from the store she plans to expand it, have a better quality of life, and most of all be able to visit her children in the US.

loans.use: Buy stock for her store including fireworks for Christmas

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es:
José de 44 años de edad, gracias al mucho esfuerzo de sus padres logro cursar un sexto grado, ya que eran un grupo bastante numeroso que tenían que mantener, su esposa se dedica a trabajar junto a él en la compra de ganado y posterior venta, también le ayuda al cultivo de maíz, han procreado 3 hijos,  dos de ellos están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad y el otro no quiso seguir estudiando le ayuda en el trabajo, los que viven con él son sus 3 hijos y su esposa.


Él se dedica a trabajar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, en la época de invierno se a dedicado a esta actividad desde que estaba muy pequeño su padre quien le enseño a trabajar a él y a sus demás hermanos, sus trabajos los realiza a un kilómetro de su casa, trabaja con su esposa quien siempre le apoya en esta actividad y su hijo mayor, madruga a ordeñar sus vacas y luego se dirige al campo donde tiene sus cultivos, también se dedica a comprar y vender ganado; ya que es otra fuente de ingreso para él  y su familia esto lo hace todos los días, donde el cliente que desee vender él se dirige a la compra no importando la distancia o la hora.


Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados, en la compra de 4 bovinos para repasto. Espera terminar de construir su casa, ya con mucho esfuerzo le a ido agregando algunas habitaciones, pero le hace falta y que sus hijos puedan estudiar y terminar sus estudios si es posible hasta la universidad.
texts.en:
Thanks to his parents' efforts 44-year old José managed to complete grade 6 even though they had a large family to support. José's wife works alongside him buying and selling livestock. She also helps him grow corn. They have three children, two of whom attend the local community school. The third son did not want to continue at school so he helps his parents. All three children and his wife live with José.

He grows corn on a 14,000 m2 plot of land in the winter. He's done this ever since he was a young boy. His father taught him and his siblings about farming. His land is about a kilometre from his house. Both his wife and his eldest son help him. The mornings are spent tending the cows, and then he sets off for his fields where he looks after his crops.

Daily buying and selling livestock is another source of income for José and his family. When a customer wishes to sell, he goes there no matter the distance or the time of day.

The loan money will be used buy four head of cattle to put out to pasture. He hopes to finish building his house--he's been working hard to add some more rooms. He also hopes that his children can continue studying, up to university if possible.

loans.use: Buy dour head of cattle to put out to pasture

loans.name: Paula

texts.en: Paula is a 33-year-old, married woman. She has three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Paula has requested a loan to buy wheel barrow, fertilizer, gloves, rake, shovel and mist blower. She became a member of SPBD in 2013. With her profits, Paula hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy wheel barrow, fertilizer, gloves, rake, shovel and mist blower.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married, and has children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a green grocery selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonal availability of products, which reduces sales.

With the 50,000 KES loan she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina works hard to support her family. Saturnina is married, and she has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Saturnina has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like spices, fish, rice, etc.

She has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Saturnina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like spices, fish, rice, etc

loans.name: José Vicente

texts.es:
José de 22 años de edad,  solo logro estudiar hasta 9° grado, debido a la pobreza en la que vivían tuvo que dejar la escuela, para ayudar a su padre en los gastos del hogar, él vive en casa con sus padres y un hermano.   

Él  se a dedicado  al comercio en una tienda, después de dejar de estudiar encontró trabajo en una tienda  y tiene 6 años de trabajar con el patrón que tiene. Antes con su papá trabajaba en la agricultura, también trabajo de pacificador en una panadería, su día comienza a las 5:00AM para llegar donde trabaja camina unos 30 minutos entra a las 6:00AM y sale a las 4:00PM, pero hoy esta solicitando este crédito para comenzar su propio negocio, pues tiene mucha experiencia en esto.   


El préstamo sera utilizado, para comprar  10 cajas  de jabón de lavar,  15 docenas de detergentes, 2 quintales de frijol, 2 de arroz, 3 de azúcar, 10 galones de aceite, 6 quintales de maíz,20 fardos de papel y más.

Su sueño siempre a sido tener su propio negocio y hoy es una buena oportunidad, además, sueña con comprar, un terreno y construir su propia casa, ya que hoy vive con sus padres,de la ganancia espera pagar el crédito y dejar las puertas abiertas, además, surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
22-year old José only has a grade 9 education. Because his family was poor he had to leave school and help his father with household expenses. He lives with his parents and a brother.

After leaving school he found work in a store. He has had the same boss for six years. He used to help his father in the fields and he's also worked as a baker. José's day starts at 5 am. He walks for half an hour to get to his place of work to start work at 6am. He leaves at 4pm. Now he is seeking a loan to start his own business as he has much experience running a business.

José wants to use the loan money to buy 10 boxes of soap, 15 dozen packages of detergent, 2 quintales of beans, 2 of rice, 3 of sugar, 10 gallons of oil, 6 quintales of corn, 20 packages of paper etc. 

His dream has always been to have his own business so today is a great opportunity. He would also like to buy some land and build a house as currently he lives with his parents. With the money he earns José wishes to pay off his loan, open his store, and buy stock for the store.

loans.use: Buy stock such as soap, detergent, beans, rice, sugar, oil, corn and paper for his store

loans.name: Gulaiym

texts.ru: Гулайым 65 лет, замужем. Гулайым и ее супруг пенсионеры, они долгое время проработали учителями в школе. На данный момент они на пенсии и несмотря, что они в преклонном возрасте они активно занимаются животноводством. У Гулайым очень большой опыт работы в этой сфере, так как животноводством она занимается на протяжении 43 лет, бизнес она начала с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Все дети женаты и проживают отдельно, только самый младший живет с родителями и помогает по хозяйству. Благодаря упорному труду Гулайым, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 6 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулайым обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку нетели для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулайым планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомашины.
texts.en:
Gulaiym is 65, married, and, along with her husband, a retired schoolteacher.  Both of them worked as teachers for a long time before retiring, and are currently farming livestock even though they're getting up there in years.  All her children are married and live on their own except for the youngest, who lives with them and helps them tend to their farm.  

Gulaiym is an old hand at raising livestock; she's been at it 43 years, and started off with only 1,000 som worth of animals.  Thanks to her persistence and hard work, she currently has 2 dairy cows and 6 sheep on her farm, and her monthly income is nearly 10,000 som.  To expand her farm, she's seeking a loan from Bai Tushum and Partners to buy a heifer.  She plans on using any extra money that the loan will allow her to make to add even more livestock to her farm, as well as to save money to buy a car.

loans.use: buy a heifer for her farm.

loans.name: Diana Milena

texts.es:
Diana, casada y con un pequeño hijo de 6 años de edad, busca a través de las ventas por catálogo generar los recursos que tanto necesita para poder salir adelante. Comenzó hace varios años vendiendo fritos, actividad que algunas veces realiza paralelamente a la comercialización por catálogo.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de inventario (cremas corporales, perfumería, cosméticos, entre otros) por la temporada de fin de año, aprovechando los paquetes promocionales que se ofrecen, y también quiere comprar materia prima, como papa, plátano, y otros, para ofrecer fritos en el barrio Barbacoa, donde es ampliamente conocida.

Su gran sueño es tener una casa propia, para lo cual trabajan arduamente su esposo y ella, darle educación a su pequeño, y desde luego tener un negocio grande desde el que se genere el ingreso que ellos necesitan y también empleo a otras personas que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Diana is married and has a little six year old child.  Through catalog sales she looks to generate the resources that are so needed in order to be able to get ahead.  She started years ago selling deep fried snacks.  She sometimes engages in this business activity at the same time that she sells by catalog.

She is requesting a loan to buy inventory (body creams, perfumes, and cosmetics, among others) for the end of the year season.  She will be taking advantage of the promotional packages that are being offered.  She also wants to buy raw materials like potatoes, bananas, and others to sell the fried snacks in the Barbacao neighborhood, where she is widely known.

Her big dream is to have her own house, for which she and her husband are working arduously.  She also dreams of giving her little one an education.  Later, she wants to have a big business, which will generate the income that she needs and give employment to people who need it.
