loans.use: to buy inventory (body creams, perfumes, and cosmetics, among others) and also to buy raw materials like potatoes, bananas, and others to sell fried snacks.

loans.name: Shehnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 43 years old and married.  She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children; one kid is too young and fully dependent upon Shehnaz.

Her husband owns a clothing business.  His practice to buy fabrics from a wholesaler; dye then into multishades, sew them into garments, and sell the garments into the market. He has a lot of customers who like to buy garments from him. 

Due to the new customers, the demand is increasing day by day, but he does not have sufficient amount to buy more fabrics. 

Therefore, Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy more fabrics to fulfill the demand.
She is in her third loan cycle and has shown an excellent repayment behavior.  She has already been taking the loan from BRAC and investing in the business.

She is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for dyeing and sewing garments to sell.

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO PROGRESO DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Toribia ella es soltera y tiene 69 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los patos y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los patos y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar patos y gallinas y alimentos para los patos y gallinas.

Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de plantas, negocio de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The “NUEVO PROGRESO DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS” communal bank is located in the district of Andahuaylillas, part of the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco.

Toribia is 69 years old, single and has two children. She works raising and selling small animals. She raises ducks and chickens, fattens them and then sells them in different markets. Through this small business she has gotten her children ahead. Her dream is to have a stall where she can sell her product. She is requesting a loan to buy ducks and chickens and feed for them.

The members in the inserted photo asked to arrive late due to work commitments. The other members sell plants, have a handicraft business, a grocery store and sell animals. The members thanks those who form part of this dream through the loan. They promise to make their payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy ducks and chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the expenses for his bachelor's degree and to pay his monthly fees

loans.name: Leata

texts.en:
Leata is 30 years old and living with her partner of four years and four children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for one year. 

Leata has requested a loan to buy flour, cooking oil, a large cooking pot, and a new oven. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Leata will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, a large cooking pot, and a new oven.

loans.name: Jaquilyn

texts.en:
Jaquilyn is married with five children and runs a general store while her husband farms to earn a living.

For six years Jaquilyn has earned well for the family. She borrowed from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more grocery goods for sale. She is hopeful to earn enough income from her business to be able to send her children to school.

She wants to have a better life with her entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods for sale

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita is married with three children. She manages her own general store while her husband operates their own farm for a living. She has been running the business for five years. She earns well for the family and is able to support the needs of her children. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to buy more grocery goods to resell. In the future, Mercedita wants to have better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
This is Flora. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of products, such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and her child's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Flora hopes to be successful in business, and dreams to have a better living. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients, such as rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: María Edelia

texts.es:
María de 39 años de edad, vive junto a su s 3 hijas, quienes tienen las edades entre 17, 14 y 13 años. Las niñas se encuentran estudiando aun. y María tiene un nivel académico de 9º grado.


Ella tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas desde hace 10 años, como propietaria y esto lo aprendió tomando en cuenta las necesidades que tenía para su  familia, así fue como tomo la decisión con su esposo de poner ese negocio.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para mejorar la vivienda y para la compra de más maíz para continuar, con su negocio de tortillas y satisfacer las necesidades que a diario se le presentan.

Ella pretende tener una vivienda que reúna,  las condiciones para su familia, como también un negocio que le permita obtener sus ingresos para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 39 years old and lives with her 3 children aged 13, 14 and 17 years old. They are all studying. María studied up to Grade 9. For the past ten years she has been selling tortillas as a business. She learned this activity considering the needs of her family and made the decision with her husband to open this business.

The loan that María is requesting is to improve her home and to buy more corn to continue with her tortilla business and to provide for the daily necessities that occur. She wants to have a house that unites the needs of her family and that of her business which allows her to generate the income that sustains her family.

loans.use: to improve her house and to buy corn to continue her tortilla business.

loans.name: Ngome

texts.en:
Ngome owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years selling household consumables such as wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbors. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 50,000 KES loan, Ngome wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat to sell at her shop.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Dora Emilse

texts.es:
Dora, a sus 29 años de edad, con la idea de salir adelante, abrió un local desde el cual comercializa telas e hilos, y ofrece servicio de confección. Es muy reconocida en el medio por su perseverancia y empuje, siempre con una sonrisa capaz de contagiar a todos sus clientes.

Con el crédito espera poder comprar surtido al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, entre otros) y, ofrecer en la temporada de fin de año mayor variedad a todos sus clientes, y poco a poco generar los recursos que tanto necesita para poder lograr su sueño anhelado, que es comprar su propio local.
texts.en:
Dora, at the age of 29, with the idea of getting ahead, opened a shop where she sells cloth and thread and offers sewing services. She is well-known in the area for her perseverance and drive, always ready with a smile to share with her customers.

Dora would like to buy stock wholesale (cloth, thread, buttons, etc.) with this loan. She will be able to offer her clients a greater variety of good at this holiday season and little by little generate the revenues she needs to fulfill her great dream, to own her own store.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale (cloth, buttons, thread, etc.).

loans.name: Cherie May

texts.en:
Cherie May works hard to support her family. Cherie May is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Cherie May requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients and materials for her business such as pork, chicken, seasonings, bamboo sticks, etc.

Cherie May has been in this business for seven years now.

Cherie May would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and materials for her business such as pork, chicken, seasonings, bamboo sticks, etc.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 43 years old and married. She has four children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for three years, and she earns additional income from food vending and from selling vegetables.

Catalina has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more items to sell in her general store. Catalina has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF, before this loan.

Catalina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 56 years old and married; she has eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

Violeta requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. In the future, Violeta would like to save money for expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Carlos Anibal

texts.es:
Carlos ha sido caficultor desde hace 35 años, el esta casado y tiene tres hijos.
Carlos esta en medio del proceso de conversión de café convencional a café orgánico. El quiere construir un establo y comprar 3 vacas para utilizar el estiércol como materia prima para hacer abonos orgánicos, esta inversión le costara 3.000.000 millones de pesos con esto el podrá iniciar su proceso de conversion a organico, mejorar la calidad y aumentar la producción del café para obtener mas recursos económicos y poder enviar a sus hijos a la universidad y tener una vivienda digna.

El proceso de conversion a cafe organico es un riesgo para los campesinos de Colombia.  En dejar la seguridad y facilidad de usar quimicos, Carlos y FCC estan convencidos que vale la pena. Con este prestamo, Carlos puede invertir en un proceso integral al largo plazo que sea independiente, saludable, y balanceado. Un prestamo con Kiva representa un futuro sostenible por su venta, su tierra, y su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos has been a coffee producer for 35 years. He is married and has three children.

Carlos is in the middle of a process of converting from conventional coffee to organic coffee. He wants to build a stable and buy three cows to use the manure as a raw material in making organic fertilizers. This investment will cost him 3,000,000 pesos. With it he will be able to start the process of converting to organic, better quality, and increased coffee production so that he can make more income and be able to send his children to university and have a respectable home.

The process of converting to organic coffee is risky for Colombian farmers. Carlos and FCC are convinced that leaving behind the security and ease of using chemicals is worth that risk. With this loan, Carlos can invest in an integral, long term process that will be independent, healthy, and balanced. A loan with Kiva represents a sustainable future for his sales, his land, and his family.

loans.use: to convert to organic coffee.

loans.name: Fialelei

texts.en:
Fialelei is a 65-year-old, married woman, with children. She has a small plantation. She grows vegetables, which she sells at her market, to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years.

Fialelei has requested a loan, with which she plans to buy fertilizer, wheel barrow, mist blower, spade, gloves, bush knives, and a rake. She became a member of SPBD in 2013. With her profits, Fialelei hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, wheel barrow, mist blower, spade, gloves, bush knives, and a rake

loans.name: Porita

texts.en:
Porita is married with five children and manages her retail store, specializing in selling spices and assorted grocery goods in the market. She has been in her business for five years, and it helped to aid her husband's income for the family. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to resell. She wants to improve her business, and she's hopeful to gain more profit for a better living of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Foisaga

texts.en: Foisaga is 43 years old and living with her partner for 22 years now and five children. She makes and sells design fabrics to earn a living, and has been doing this for one year. Foisaga has requested a loan to buy paints, paint brush, design board, fabric materials, and a new sewing machine. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paints, paint brush, design board, fabric materials, and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Baby Liza

texts.en:
Baby Liza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business farming vegetables in the Philippines.

Baby Liza requested a 13000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional seeds for her farm.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Baby Liza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds for her farm

loans.name: Cherriel

texts.en:
Cherriel is 30 years old and married. Cherriel has four children and three are still in school.

Cherriel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Cherriel requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cherriel has been in this business for 5 years now and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Cherriel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Kerana

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Kerana works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buy-and-sell dried coconut meat. Kerana is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell in her buy-and-sell banana business.

Kerana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell.

loans.name: Lenelyn

texts.en:
Lenelyn works hard to support her family. Lenelyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Lenelyn requested a PHP 13,500 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat, such as paint, wood, etc.

Lenelyn has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Lenelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat, such as paint, wood, etc.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu, because she has gone far with her business with support from the loans.

Here again, she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 20,000. She plans to use it to buy five litres of shampoo, conditioner, hair braids, and gel. She thanks Yehu and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy five litres of shampoo, conditioner, hair braids, and gel

loans.name: Mangale

texts.en:
Mangale is married and has seven children, all of whom attend school. He lives at his own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are household consumables.

For over thirteen years, he has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women. He cites seasonality as his major business challenge. Mangale dreams of establishing a boutique, in the near future.

With the KES 50,000 loan, he wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for his business. He decided to join Yehu, in order to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for his business.

loans.name: Ever Ulises

texts.es:
EVER DE 24 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTUDIO HASTA OCTAVO GRADO, PUES LOS ESCASOS RECURSOS ECONOMICOS NO LE PERMITIERON SEGUIR ESTUDIANDO Y TUVO QUE DEDICARSE DE LLENO A TRABAJAR, SU PAREJA ES AMA DE CASA, HAN PROCREADO DOS HIJOS DE 4 Y DOS MESES DE EDAD RESPECTIVAMNETE, UNO DE HIJOS VA A EMPEZAR A IR AL KINDER.

 EVER ES AGRICULTOR EN PEQUEÑO, TRABAJA 7,000 METROS CUADRADOS DE MAIZ, LO APRENDIO DESDE NIÑO YA QUE SU PADRE ERA AGRICULTOR Y LE ENSEÑO ESTE TRABAJO, ADEMAS TRAJABA EN UN TALLER DE CARPINTERIA, DESDE HACE 15 AÑOS YA QUE HAY MOMENTOS EN LOS CUALES LA COSECHA NO DA MAS QUE PARA EL CONSUMO, PAGAR ALGUNAS DEUDAS, ÉL NO TIENE HORARIO DE TRABAJO PUES CUANDO ESTA EN EL TALLER ENTRA A LAS 7AM Y COMO GANA POR OBRA NO TIENE HORA DE SALIDA.

CON EL PRESTAMO VA A TRABAJAR 7,000 METROS CUADRADOS DE MAIZ DE RIEGO, QUE SI DIOS LO PERMITE EN ABRIL ESTARA SACANDO LA COSECHA. CON EL PRESTAMO TIENE MAYOR OPORTUNIDAD DE SALIR ADELANTE, PUES EL DINERO QUE GANA EN EL TALLER DE CARPINTERIA LO UTILIZARA PARA EL ESTUDIO  DE SU HIJO Y PARA LA ALIMENTACION DE SU FAMILIA.


  SUS SUEÑOS SON TENER UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA Y ASI PODER AYUDAR A SUS HIJOS, A QUE PUEDAN TENER EL ESTUDIO QUE EL NO TUVO. EL PRESTAMO LE AYUDARA DE IMPULSO PARA TRABAJAR, SERA MAS SACRIFICADO PERO ESTA SEGURO QUE SOLO ASI PODRA CUMPLIR CON SUS SUEÑOS Y LOS DE SU FAMILIA. TAMBIEN PIENSA YA NO SER EMPLEADO DEL TALLER, SINO TENER SU PROPIO TALLER DE CARPINTERIA.
texts.en:
Ever is 24 years old. He only studied until the 8th grade because financial resources were scarce and he could not continue his school work and so he dedicated himself full time to working. His partner is a housewife and they have 2 children. One is 4 and about to begin kindergarten and one is 2 months old.

Ever is a small farmer. He works 7,000 square meters of corn. He learned as a youth since his father was a farmer and taught him this work. He has also been working for 15 years in a carpentry workshop as there are times when the harvest only provides enough for consumption and he needs to pay some expenses. He does not have a work schedule but when he is in the workshop he gets there at 7:00AM and as he is paid by piece work he does not have a set departure time. 

He plans to use the loan to work 7,000 square meters of irrigated corn, God willing, to harvest in April. The loan gives him an opportunity to get ahead as the money that he earns in the carpentry workshop will be used to pay for school fees for his son and for feeding the family.

His dreams are to have a better quality of life and to be able to support his children so they can have the education he was not able to have. The loan will provide a motivation to work and make more sacrifices in order to be certain not only that he can meet his dreams and those of his family but also he is thinking of not being an employee of a workshop but to have his own carpentry workshop.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to work 7,000 square meters of irrigated corn.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
After losing her husband to the violence of South Sudan, Joyce fled the country with her children in search of a new life. When she arrived in Kenya, she made contact with a British organization that assists refugees in Nairobi, and after a few months of waiting, Joyce and her family were permitted to immigrate to the United States as refugees.

Despite experiencing the tremendous culture shock of moving to a new country, Joyce made the best of her situation. She found a job at a San Diego health center and worked there until she was recently laid off.  She began looking for employment through a temporary employment agency, but had difficulty finding a job in the crowded job market. Instead of letting her circumstances hold her back, she instead saw it as an opportunity to take her employment into her own hands. 

She began selling a variety of cultural goods, such as traditional Sudanese clothing and art pieces, taking out her first microloan to fund her venture.  She eventually moved into selling lotions, perfumes and crèmes at local swap meets, focusing on selling consumer goods that would appeal to the local African immigrant community.  

Now on her eighth microloan, Joyce has demonstrated tremendous character through the years with regular, on-time repayments and a commitment to growing her business. She plans to use her $4,000 Kiva loan to increase her inventory, enabling her to sell at additional outdoor markets and ultimately grow her income.

When asked what her business dream would be, she shared, “I want to become financially independent and perhaps start my own import and export business one day.”

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Sreyheang

texts.en:
Sreyheang (pictured here), age 23, is single. She lives with her parents in a village in Phnom Penh suburb. 
Sreyheang had finished her baccalaureate and wants to continue her bachelor's degree at the university where she is majoring. Hence, she has decided to apply for a loan to pay her school fees.

Credit to study a bachelor's degree in Cambodia: There are four years, divided into two semesters each year; first and second semester. Students can prefer to pay school fees by a year or by a semester, depending on the school or university's privacy policy.

loans.use: to pay for her school fees.

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.en:
Crescencia works hard to support her family. Crescencia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Crescencia requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Crescencia has been in this business for 25 years.

Crescencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. Lolita is married and has a rice farming business in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lolita has been in this business for 4 years.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 40 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marissa is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marissa has been raising pigs for 10 years, and earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Crystal Mae

texts.en:
Crystal Mae is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Crystal Mae is 25 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Crystal Mae has a soft drink and ice vending business in the Philippines. Crystal Mae requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more cases of soft drinks to sell.

Crystal Mae has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Crystal Mae would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more cases of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Teresa Aracely

texts.es:
Teresa es una joven de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, ella es casada su esposo se dedica los trabajos de estructuras metálicas, ellos tienen 2 hijos; una niña de 5 años y un niño de 2 años de edad y que actualmente la pequeña se encuentra estudiando la preparatorio, en su vivienda solo viven y dependen de  ella su esposo y su dos hijos. 

Teresa, se dedica a los trabajos de oficios domésticos en su hogar y cuidar a sus hijos; mientras su esposo sale al trabajo, comenta que desde que ella estaba pequeña se dedica a esta actividad, pues es un trabajo hereditario por parte de su mamá, que desde que estaba pequeña su madre le enseño a aprender este oficio, ella dice que es una actividad muy importante y que se siente orgullosa de desempeñarla en su familia y también ella siempre recibe el apoyo de su esposo en los trabajos que desarrolla. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para la instalación de la energía eléctrica en su hogar; pues hasta el momento no cuentan con ese beneficio que es tan indispensables para ellos y que desde hace ya varios años tenían el deseo de poner la energía eléctrica en su hogar, este beneficio les permitirá a  su familia vivir más cómodamente en su hogar y no estar en el oscuro por las noches, esto les generara inseguridad en su hogar pues no se contaba con la iluminación adecuada.  

Teresa siempre ha querido seguir estudiando y trabajar a la vez, terminar una carrera universitaria. Vivir en un casa digna  para su familia y para su niño desea que sea una persona de bien que estudie mucho. El otorgamiento del crédito siente una gran oportunidad para ella y su familia, de seguir superándose día a día   y con el otorgamiento de futuros créditos que sacara para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa is a young woman of 25 years who studied until ninth grade. She is married and her husband earns his living working working with metal structures. They have two children, a five-year-old girl and a two-year-old boy. The little girl is currently studying in pre-school. They live in their home and Teresa and her two children are supported by her husband.

Teresa dedicates herself to the work of the household chores in her home and the care of her children while her husband goes to work. She says that since she was small she has been engaged in this activity that was taught to her by her own mother. Since she was little her mother helped her learn this activity and Teresa says it is a very important activity and that she is proud to preform it for her family and that she is always supported by her husband in the work they do.

The loan she is requesting is for the installation of electricity in their home because, up to now, they do not have this service that is so necessary for them. For several years they have had the desire to put electricity in their home and not be in the dark at night, a condition which generated insecurity at home because there was no proper lighting.

Teresa has always wanted to continue studying and working and finish a college career. She wants to live in a house that is dignified and for her child to be a good person and study a lot. The granting of this loan feels like a great opportunity for her and her family to continue growing day by day and by giving the chance to take out future loans to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to install electricity in her home.

loans.name: Marío Rodolfo

texts.es:
El joven Mario de 21 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora con un grado de estudio de bachiller general, que fue lo que pudieron darles sus padres, con mucho esfuerzo salió adelante. Vive solo con su madre, quien fue la que le ha ayudado en mucho; ya que perdió a su padre desde muy pequeño, hoy vive solo con su madre que ha significado mucho en la vida junto a crecido su hermano, quien le ayuda en los trabajos agrícolas, y es así como trabajan juntos y salen adelante con los trabajos que realizan y de ellos solo su madre depende.

Mario se dedica a trabajos agrícolas desde que tenía 16 años de edad, su padre le fue enseñando, a como trabajar en el campo y es gracias a su padre que hoy conoce de mucho, sobre las diferentes actividades que requiere un cultivo, en esta actividades se involucra el hermano quien junto con el cultivan 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y frijol. Para llegar a la zona de trabajo debe caminar 45 min, para realizar sus trabajos cuando también al momento de sacar su cosecha le toca que sacarlos cargándolos, en su espalda o en bestias y sus horas de trabajo no tiene si no que lo hace hasta que termine su trabajo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para pago de mano de obra, para sacar su cosecha ya que se le hace difícil a él solo y su hermano; porque es bastante los trabajos que tienen y con esto se estará ayudando al cliente que se le puedan facilitar el traslado de su cosecha a su casa y así poder sacar su cosecha para venderla y tener ingresos para salir con el crédito y ayudar a su madre en los gastos de su casa.

Piensa continuar trabajando, en la agricultura y poder cosechar más en el próximo año y para eso espera que su hermano siempre le ayude y también tenga el apoyo de su madre, para salir adelante y también piensa en poder comprar un terreno, para construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Mario is a hard-working young man of 21 years of age. He finished his High School which his parents struggled to provide him with in order to get ahead. He lives with his mother, who is the person who helped him in so much, growing up together with his brother. The brothers work together in agriculture and their mother is dependent on them.

Mario has worked in agriculture since he was 16. His father taught him to work the fields and thanks to this he has a lot of knowledge today about the different activities required to produce a harvest. He and his brother work together growing 10,500 square meters of corn and beans. They have to walk 45 minutes to get to their fields. And to work and to sell their harvest they have to carry the product on their backs or by animal. They don't have normal work hours, they work until the job is done.

The loan that Marío is requesting is to pay for labor to harvest their crops as it is too difficult for just him and his brother. They have a lot of work to do and this helps their client as the crops have to be transported to his house. From there the harvest can be sold and they will have income to pay the loan and help their mother with the household expenses.

Marío wants to continue working in agriculture and wants to harvest more in the coming season. So he hopes his brother will continue to help him. He also has the support of his mother to help him along. He is thinking of buying a plot of land to build his own house.

loans.use: to pay for labor to harvest their crops.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a married mother and has children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

She is operating an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat, and the rest she will use to construct a stall for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat, and construct a stall for the business.

loans.name: Sam Ath

texts.en:
Sam Ath (in the photo), age 25, is single. He lives with his parents on the Island of Mekong River. His father is a construction worker and mother is a weaver.

Sam Ath is now a third year student, majoring in Architecture. In addition, he works as an assistant for a company in Phom Penh. 
Sam Ath will graduate in 2016. In the future, he hopes to have a good job and get a salary of about $500 a month.

He has decided to apply for a loan to pay his school fees.

loans.use: to pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Dallas

texts.en: Dallas is 25 years old, single with no children. She has a small bingo business, which she has been running for one year. Dallas needs a loan to buy a new bingo machine, bingo paper, a desk, and a chair. She will use her profits to improve her business. Dallas joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new bingo machine, bingo paper, a desk, and a chair.
